This group started when one of its members had contact with the foundation. The group is in its eighth cycle. It has worked with the Fundación since 2006.  

One of the members is María. She has 2 children, and she is married to Ramon. Her husband works in Argentina  and she sells clothing. She remarks that is going very well for her since she has a lot of orders for the clothes she sells. That is why she is asking for a loan, to be able to stock up and satisfy her customers' demands.

All of the women in the group and Maria are very grateful for the opportunity that the Foundation and Kiva are giving them to access help.

loans.use: to buy clothes to later sell.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales como pollos,cuyes y gallinas y ahora tambien se esta dedicando al negocio de compra y venta de ganado y los hace engordar y luego los vende en las distintas ferias que existe en el distrito de Anta,la socia por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de crianza de animales y negocio de compra y venta de ganado.La socia solicita el credito para comprar pollos,gallinas,cuyes y un ganado.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member is still working breeding animals such as chickens, guinea pigs, hens and now she is also working in the business of buying and selling cattle and fattening them to sell at various market places that exist in the district of Anta. 

The member through this work supports her children. Her dream is to expand the business of breeding animals and the buying and selling of cattle. 

The member is asking for a loan in order to buy chickens, hens, guinea pigs and cattle. The member is happy for the loan and she promises to make her payments as agreed.

loans.use: to buy chickens, hens, guinea pigs and cattle

loans.name: San Javier De Sanca Jahuira Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SAN JAVIER DE SANCA JAHUIRA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Copacabana, está compuesta por once integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Yola. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de pescado, tienda de barrio, venta de chamarras.

La señora Yola,  indica que es el primer ciclo que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio que viene trabajando hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de su trabajo

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de conservas) que adquirirá de La Paz y posteriormente lo venderá en su comunidad. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella vive con sus padres.
texts.en:
The San Javier de Sanca Jahuira communal bank will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Copacabana regional office.  It is made up of 11 members and managed by a board of directors headed by Yola.  The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry out are varied, among which we have fish sales, a neighborhood store, and jacket sales.

Yola indicates that this is the first cycle she has worked with Pro Mujer and that she joined the institution on the invitation of a facilitator.  Currently she has a neighborhood store business that she has had for years, having learned it through her job.

The loan she will get now is to increase her capital buying canned goods that she will acquire in La Paz and later sell in her community.  This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family, since she lives with her parents.

loans.use: to buy canned food.

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es:
El señor Jesús acaba de ser padre y quiere la seguridad y comodidad de su familia en la casa. Es por eso que solicita un préstamo para el techo del cuarto de lavado y el vitropiso de la casa.
Con las instalación del victopiso podrán tener mayor comodidad y pensando el bienestar de su familia; y colocar el techo ya que estamos en la temporada de lluvia están maltratando los muebles y hay humedad en la casa y le afecta en la salud a su bebe. 
Don Jesús trabaja desde hace casi dos años en una empresa en la que se dedica a instalaciones eléctricas, y su esposa se dedica a los labores domesticas y al cuidado de su bebe ya que tiene pocos días de nacido.
El señor Jesús es una persona muy trabajadora que desea darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Señor Jesús has just become a father and wants to ensure the security and comfort of his family at home. This is why he is asking for a loan to install a roof in laundry room and lay glazed tiles on the floors of the house.
 
Thinking to the welfare of his family, they will be more comfortable with the installation of tiles. He wants to install a roof as it is the rainy season and the furniture is getting spoilt, the house is damp and it is affectingthe baby's health.

Don Jesus has worked for nearly two years in a company that does electrical installations. His wife does the housework and cares for the baby as it is only a few days old.

Señor Jesús is a hardworking person who wants to give his family the best.

loans.use: to install a roof in one of the rooms and lay glazed tiles on the floors in the house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chayotes, carrots, potatoes, tomatoes, oranges, pineapples and yucca.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario, de 22 años es una joven alegre. Hace 2 años se casó con Ronald, su esposo. Con quien todavía no tienen hijos, se quieren mucho y forjan su futuro en casa de sus suegros, ubicada en la localidad de Daniel Hernández. 
 Ella tiene las ganas de salir adelante y aunque está delicada de salud, por problemas con el estómago, no se declina. Mantiene la alegría y ganas de luchar por la vida. Junto a su hermana y su esposo, trabajan en el negocio de venta de leña, donde obtiene buenas ganancias. Pues ellos mismo elaboran, comprando árboles al por mayor. El trabajo es arduo sobre todo porque, tiene que cortar muchos árboles y hasta se quedan toda la noche realizando su labor. Porque tienen que tener muchos millares de leña, para comercializarlos en la ciudad de Huancayo, donde el precio es mucho mayor. Así pueden tener más ganancia. Ahora desea comprar su casa propia, pues está juntando dinero para hacer realidad su sueño. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “las estrellas” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anterior crédito. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias.
Rosario de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de árboles para realizar más leña.
texts.en:
Rosario is 22 years old and a cheerful young person. She got married 2 years ago to Ronald, her husband, with whom she has as yet to have children. They love each other very much and are building a future at their in-laws house located in the town of  Daniel Hernández. 

She has the desire to get ahead and although of a delicate disposition due to stomach problems, she refuses to give up. She remains positive with a desire to fight for life. Together with her sister and husband, she works selling firewood which makes them a healthy profit. They themsleves produce the firewood, buying trees wholesale. The work is especially hard as you have to chop up a lot of trees and even stay up all night to finish the work, because they have to have many peices of firewood to sell in the city of Huancayo where the price is a lot higher and gives them a bigger profit. She now wants to buy her own house and is saving money to realize her dream. She belongs to the communal bank "Las Estrellas" and this is her first loan with MFP and so hopes to have your help to pursue her goals. On the other hand, she agrees to make her repayments as with a previous loan. In addition she likes being a part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible people and very supportive.

Rosario, on receiving your help, will invest the requested money in the purchase of trees to produce more firewood.

loans.use: to buy more trees.

loans.name: Renato

texts.es: Renato, de 26 años es un hijo ejemplar. Vive en compañía de sus 3 hermanos, quienes estudian. Ellos viven en casa de su padre ubicada en la localidad de Pampas. Gracias a su esfuerzo, pudo comprar su propio motocarro, con lo que realiza trasporte público a diferentes lugares de la ciudad. Desde hace 20 años viene trabajando en la empresa de trasportes “turismo Tayacaja”. Cuenta que en obtiene de ganancias mínimas semanales un promedio de 200 nuevos soles, a la semana. Pero días festivos y de celebraciones del pueblo, obtiene mejores ganancias. Asimismo los fines de semana, viaja a su pueblo a cuidar de sus cultivos de maíz y papa, los cuales siembra en terrenos que le heredaron sus padres. En época de cosecha, viaja ala ciudad de Huancayo a comercializar sus alimentos y así obtener mejores ganancias. Él pertenece al grupo solidario “santa rosa del estanque” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anterior crédito. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Renato, de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales y guano de islas; para esparcir entre sus cultivos de maíz.
texts.en: Renato, 26 is an exemplary son. He lives with his 3 brothers, who are studying. They live in their father's house located in the town of Pampas. Thanks to his efforts, he was able to buy his own trickshaw with which he transports people to different parts of the city. For the last 20 years he has been working for the transport company "Turismo Tayacaja". He says that he makes a small weekly profit of about 200 nuevos soles (PEN). However, on public holidays and when there is a festival in town he makes more profit. Similarly, at the weekends. he goes back to his town to take care of his corn and potato crop, which he plants on land his parents left him. During harvest time, he goes to the city of Huancayo to sell his products to get a better return. He belongs to the communal bank "Santa Rosa del Estanque" and this is his 3rd loan with MFP and he hopes that with your help he will be able to reach his goals. On the other hand he promises to make his repayments as with his previous loan. In addition, he likes being a part of his communal bank as all the members are responsible people and very supportive. Renato, on receiving your support, will invest the requested money in the purchase of natural fertilizers and guano from the islands to spread among his corn crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Eugenia; tiene 45años de edad, y es casada y tiene 5 hijos; La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de compra y venta de ganados y ahora tambien se esta dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales como ovejas,ella los hace engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias que existe en la ciudad de Anta,por medio de este negcoio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de compra y venta de ganados y tambien el negocio de crianza de animales . La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar 1 ganado.

 La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member is Sra. Eugenia; she is 45 years old, married and has 5 children. The member continues in the business of buying and selling cattle and now also raises livestock such as sheep. She fattens them and then sells them at the different street markets in the city of Anta. By means of this business, the member takes care of her children. The member's dream is to expand both her businesses: the buying and selling of cattle and the raising of livestock. The member is asking for the loan to buy one head of cattle.

The member is grateful for the requested loan and agrees to make the repayments in the established time frame.

loans.use: to buy a head of cattle.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es: Liz, de 24 años es una mujer responsable. Cuida de sus 2 hijos: Mayte y Ángelo con quienes vive en casa de su madre, ubicada en la localidad de Santa rosa. Desde hace algunos años, forjó su destino y el de sus hijos, sola, trabajando con mucho esfuerzo para cubrir los gastos de sus hijos. Se siente orgullosa de si misma. Todas las mañanas desde los primeros rayos de sol. Sale a cuidar de sus sembríos de maíz, papa, cebada y trigo. Los cuales después de cada cosecha los comercializa en la ciudad de Pampas, los días domingo después de la feria. Además aprovecha ese tiempo para comercializar sus animales, entre vacas, cerdos y ovejas. A los cuales le engorda, para obtener un mayor precio. Ahora desea juntar la mayor cantidad de dinero para los estudios de sus hijos. Pues desea brindarles una buena educación. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “santa rosa del estanque” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anterior crédito. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Liz, de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir en sus sembríos de maíz.
texts.en:
Liz is 24 years old and is a responsible woman. She cares for her two children, Mayte and Ángelo, who live at home with their mother in the town of Santa Rosa. 

For some years she has forged her fate and that of her children, alone, working with much effort in order to cover the expenses of her children. She feels proud of herself. Every morning at the first rays of the sun she leaves to care for her crops of corn, potatoes, barley and wheat. She later sells her crops in the city of Pampas, afterwards on Sundays at the street market.

She also takes advantage of this time to sell her animals, including cows, pigs and sheep, which she fattens in order to obtain a better price. Now she wants to scrape together as much money as she can to pay the school fees for her children. She wants to provide them with a good education. 

She belongs to the communal bank Santa Rosa del Estanque and this is her second loan through MFP and she is waiting for approval, in order to continue with her goals. And she in turn promises to make her payments as agreed, as she did in her previous loan. Also, she likes being a part of the communal bank because all of the members are responsible and caring people. Liz, upon receiving your help, will use the money from the loan to buy natural fertilizer to sprinkle on her corn fields.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer

loans.name: 6 De Marzo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “6 DE MARZO” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Collpani, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Paulina es la presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tejido de awayos, venta de pescado, tejido de mantas, venta de papa.

La señora Paulina,  indica que es la primera vez que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de la asesora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de awayos que viene trabajando hace años atrás, el mismo lo aprendió de su mamá.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de la 16 de julio y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
The communal bank 6 DE MARZO (March 6th) will begin its first cycle at Pro Mujer, as part of the Collpani branch and it has 6 members and is headed by a board headed by Paulina as president. 

The businesses of the members of the communal bank are varied including among them we have the weaving of awayos (hand woven textiles using natural dyes), fish sales, blanket weavings, and selling potatoes.

Paulina tells us this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer and she joined the communal bank through the invitation of the counselor. Currently she has a business weaving awayos that she has had for some years, and which she learned from her mother.

The money from the loan that she is asking for is to have cash on hand to buy wool which she will buy at the July 16 Market, and she will use it to make and sell through orders. This work allows her to earn money to support her family; she has a common-law relationship and a son.

When asked what it is she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training sessions.

loans.use: to buy wool for weaving

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Doña Ana es una señora con 59 años de edad, casada, madre de tres hijos. Vive solamente con su esposo, ya que sus hijos formaron su propio hogar. Su esposo sale a trabajar, ella realiza los oficios domésticos primeramente y luego sale a vender sus productos. Es trabajadora y tiene muchos deseos de crecer y salir adelante tanto a nivel personal como en su negocio. Hace más de diez años se dedica al comercio ambulante y ventas por catálogos. Le va muy bien gracias a su experiencia. Siempre ha trabajado con clientes que no le han quedado mal con sus pagos, por lo que ahora quiere abrir nuevos mercados. Debido a ésto,ella toma la decisión de pedir financiamiento a la Fundación. Es su segundo crédito. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo en la toma de decisiones y con el de sus hijas para las ventas y cobros de su mercadería.
texts.en: Ana is a 59 year old woman. She is married and the mother of three children. She lives alone with her husband, since her children have started their own homes. Her husband goes out to work, and first she does the domestic tasks and then goes out to sell her products. She is hardworking and really wants to grow and get ahead on the personal and business level. For more than ten years, she has been a street vendor and has also done catalog sales. It is going very well for her due to her experience. She has always worked with customers who have made their payments, and now she wants to go into new markets. Because of that, she made the decision to ask the Foundation for financing. This is her second loan. She has her husband's support making her decisions and one of her daughters helps her with the sales and collecting of the merchandise.

loans.use: to invest in buying merchandise.

loans.name: Belen

texts.es: Belén, de 56 años es una señora sencilla. Vive en compañía de Máximo, su esposo desde hace 30 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos, de los cuales solo vive con 2 de ellos en su casa propia, ubicada en Pampas. Ella es una mujer trabajadora. Se dedica a varias actividades, pues su mayor sueño es brindar a sus hijos lo mejor. En las mañanas se dedica a la crianza de sus 6 vacas de las cuales lleva a pastar, para que le proporcione una buena leche. Pues realiza queso y lleva a vender ella misma a la capital del país. Donde obtiene un dinero adicional, pues es muy conocida. Además de dedicarse a la siembra de maíz, papa, alverja y quinua. Los que cuida gracias a sus esposo, quien también le ayuda. Juntos en cada cosecha comercializa sus alimentos en la feria de Pampas. Ahora ella desea incursionar en la compra y venta de cerveza, donde espera obtener buenas ganancias, ya que tiene gran demanda. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario”los pétalos” y este es el octavo crédito con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anterior crédito. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Belén de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales y abono para esparcir entre sus sembríos de maíz; que tiene en 3 hectáreas de terreno agrícola.
texts.en: Belén is 56 years old and a humble woman. She lives with Máximo, her husband of 30 years. They both have 3 children and live with 2 of them in their own home, located in Pampas. She is a hardworking woman with various activities. Her biggest dream is to offer her children the best. Mornings she raises her 6 cows that she takes out to pasture, so they can supply good milk. She makes cheese that she herself takes to the capital to sell. This gives her addition money, as she is very well known. Besides growing corn, potatoes, peas and quinoa. She cares for the crops thanks to her husband, who helps her. Together they harvest and sell their food at the Pampas fair. Now she wants to get into buying and selling beer, where she hopes to obtain good profit, since there is a lot of demand.  She belongs to "Los Pétalos" [The Petals] support group, and this is her eighth loan with MFP.  She hopes for your cooperation to continue with her goals. She is also happy to belong to the association because all of the members are responsible and supportive people. If Belén receives your support, she will invest the money she has asked for in purchasing natural and chemical fertilizer to spread on her corn crops. She has 3 hectares of farmland.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the waterproofing of her roof

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es: Lucy, de 23 años es una mujer alegre. Vive desde hace 9 años con Juan, su esposo. Ambos tienen 2 hermosas hijas, a las que cuidan en casa de su mamá; ubicada en la localidad de Pampas. Desde que conformó su familia, ella trabajó con ahínco para salir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida. Por ello, su motor de progreso es la compra del terreno para construir su casa. Es así que ahorraron dinero para hacer realidad su sueño. Hace poco compraron un terreno y esperan construirlo con rapidez, pues tienen que ahorrar mucho más. Su actividad económica es la crianza de cerdos, los cuales engorda para luego venderlos a un mayor precio. Le va muy bien en su trabajo, sobre todo las épocas festivas, donde obtiene mejores ingresos. Asimismo su esposo trabaja en el gobierno de su ciudad, como secretario de la máxima autoridad; con  ello obtienen un ingreso extra a su negocio. Ahora planea trabajar con más empeño, pues quiere construir su casa y mejorar la granja de sus animales. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “amigas al futuro” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Lucy; de obtener su apoyo, invertirá le dinero solicitado en la compra de adobe de tierra, para construir su casa y un pequeño espacio para el corral de sus animales.
texts.en:
Lucy, age 23, is a happy woman.  She has lived with her husband, Juan, for nine years.  They have two beautiful daughters, whom she takes care of in her mother’s house in Pampas.

Ever since she formed her family she has worked earnestly to improve her quality of life.  In order to do so her engine towards progress is the purchase of land to build her house.  That is why she is saving money in order to make her dream a reality.  A little while ago they bought some land, and they hope to build on it quickly.  However, they need to save a lot more.

Her business is raising pigs.  She fattens them in order to then sell them for a higher price.  It is going very well for her in her work.  It goes especially well during the holidays when she gets more income.  Her husband works in a position of authority for the city government.  With his work they get an extra income for her business.

She now plans to work with more determination because she wants to build her house and improve the farm for her animals.

She belongs to the “Amigas al Futuro” (Friends to the Future) communal bank.  This is her first loan with MFP.  She hopes for your collaboration in order to continue with her objective.  She pledges to make her payments.  She is pleased to be part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible and very supportive people.

Upon receiving your support she will use the requested loan to buy adobe in order to build her house and a small space for a pen for her animals.

loans.use: to buy adobe.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es:
El señor Ismael solicita el crédito para poder surtir su tienda de mercancías tanto de abarrotes, como comprar refrescos al mayoreo.
El señor lleva con su negocio aproximadamente 3 años, anteriormente tuvo una ferreteria pero la tuvo que cerrar porque ya no estab rindiendo lo suficiente pero como es un hombre muy emprenderor abrio un pequeño abarrotes el cual con el paso de los años ha ido creciendo y el deceo del señor ismael es que se vuelva mas grande; por lo cual este credito sera de mucha ayuda para que el pueda cumplir con este objetivo.
texts.en:
Ismael is requesting the loan in order to be able to stock his store with merchandise like groceries and soft drinks in bulk.  He has been in this business for approximately three years.  Previously he had a hardware shop, but he had to close it because it did not produce enough income.

However, as he is an enterprising man, he opened a small grocery store.  As the years pass it has been growing.  Isamael’s wish is for it to get bigger.  This loan will be of great help so that he will be able to meet his objective.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his grocery store.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana, de 66 años es una mujer sencilla; vive en compañía de Hilario su esposo desde hace 40 años. Ambos tienen 5 hijos, de los cuales solo vive con 2 de ellos en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Atocc. Desde niña, gusto de vivir en el campo y gozar de su clima y de los verdes pastos. Por ello, continua trabajando y a pesar de su avanzada edad quiere morir en el campo como creció. Sembrando y cuidando a sus animales. Sus principales sembríos constan de papa, alverja y habas los que en cada cosecha comercializa a la ciudad de Huancayo o a la capital del país, donde consigue mayores ingresos. Todo esto lo realiza, gracias al apoyo de su esposo e hijos, a quienes enseño el oficio de la agricultura. De igual manera cuida a su ganados, vacas de calidad de las cuales extrae leche para consumir y comercializarlos a un mayor precio. De es manera obtienen una ganancia extra que le ayude a progresar. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “trabajemos juntos” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anterior crédito. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Juana, de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entre sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Juana, age 66, is an unassuming woman.  She has lived with her husband, Hilario, for 40 years.  They have five children.  She only lives with two of them in her own house in Atocc.

Since she was a young girl she has liked living in the country and enjoying its climate and the green pastures.  That is why, in spite of her advanced age, she wants to die in the country where she grew up planting and taking care of her animals.

Her main crops are potatoes, peas, and beans.  She sells each harvest in the city of Huancayo or in the capital of the country where she obtains greater income.  She does all of this thanks to the support from her husband and children, to whom she taught the trade of farming.  In a similar way she takes care of her livestock, quality cows that give milk for consumption and for sale at a higher price.  This way they get an extra income that helps them progress.

She belongs to the “Trabajemos Junotos” (Let’s Work Together) communal bank.  This is her third loan with MFP.  She hopes for your collaboration in order to continue with her objectives.  She pledges to make her payments like she did with a previous loan.  She is pleased to be part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible and very supportive people.

Upon receiving your support she will use the requested loan to buy natural fertilizers to spread among her crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizers.

loans.name: Mariana De Jesús

texts.es:
Mariana es una mujer muy trabajadora, responasble en sus labores ya que tiene que mantener a sus tres hijos. Mariana vive con sus hijos en Ambato provincia de Tungurahua, Zona Centro de Ecuador. Trabaja sola en la crianza de cuyes.

Este negocio para Mariana es muy importante ya que es la única fuente de ingresos económicos para su familia que son sus tres hijos. Mariana realiza el segundo crédito en Fodemi, mismo que va a invertir en la compra de cuyes de raza ya que necesita mejorar la raza de los que tiene en su casa, debido a que los de raza son más cotizados en el mercado, aspira a vender más y a obtener un mejor ingreso ya que la necesidad de educar a sus hijos y de alimentarlos le hacen seguir adelante.

El sueño de Mariana es poder distribuir fuera de la ciudad y expandir su negocio a toda la región.
texts.en:
Mariana is a woman who is very hardworking and responsible in her work, because she has to support her three children.  Mariana lives with her children in Ambato province in Tungurahua in the central part of Ecuador.  She works on her own raising guinea pigs.

For Mariana, this business is very important because it is the only source of income for her family, which includes 3 children.  Mariana is taking her second loan from FODEMI, and she will use it to invest in the purchase of purebred guinea pigs, since she wants to improve the breed that she has in her house.  The purebred guinea pigs are more valuable in the market, and so she hopes to increase her sales with them and obtain a better income, since she needs to pay for her children's education and food.

Mariana dreams of distributing her guinea pigs outside of the city and expanding her business throughout the region.

loans.use: to buy purebred guinea pigs to improve the breed of the guinea pigs that she is raising

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase sheets, bedspreads, shirts, undergarments and products for her grocery store.

loans.name: Julio César

texts.es: Julio César está solicitando el crédito para pagar un Postgrado en Dirección y Estrategias de Negocio. Actualmente se ecnuentra laborando, y es por eso que desea reforzar su carrera en Relaciones Internacionales, lo cual hará a través del estudio de éste Postgrado. Julio quiere trabajar para una institución del gobierno que se especialice en el apoyo comunitario, donde se desarrolle proyectos con el fin de apoyar a las familias y el crecimiento del país
texts.en: Julio César is requesting the loan in order to pay for postgraduate studies in Business Management Strategies.  He is currently working and wants to strengthen his career in International Relations, which he will do with his postgraduate studies.  Julio wants to work for a government institution that specializes in community support and develops projects to support families and the growth of his country.

loans.use: to pay for his postgraduate studies.

loans.name: Ana Gabriela

texts.es:
Ana Gabriela tiene 30 años de edad y vive con su familia en una comunidad de la provincia de Guanacaste. La economía de la zona de Guanacaste se fundamenta principalmente en la ganadería, aunque también en esta región se practican la apicultura y acuacultura.

Desde hace varios años que Ana Gabriela se dedica a la venta de ropa para superarse cada día, pero anteriormente lo hacía con sus hermanas, ahora ha tomado la decisión de vender su propia ropa. Desde que  ingreso a este negocio los resultados han sido buenos, ya que ha tenido una gran aceptación en su comunidad. 

En estos momentos lo que desea Ana Gabriela es solicitar un préstamo por ¢300,000(trescientos mil colones) para la compra de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, para así invertir en inventario para poder vender, para  obtener  ganancia para incrementar su recursos económicos y de igual manera sacar a su hija de 8 años de edad adelante. 

Ana Gabriela es miembro de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Guaitil S.A,  razón por la cual se siente  muy agradecida por las oportunidades  de acceso al crédito que esta le brinda y poder llevar a cabo sus proyectos de vida.
texts.en:
Ana Gabriela, 30, lives with her family in a community in Guancaste province.  The economy of the Guancaste region is based mainly on animal husbandry, although in this region you also see beekeeping and aquaculture.

For a number of years, Ana Gabriela has been selling clothing in order to get by each day.  Previously, she worked with her sisters, but now she has made the decision to sell clothing on her own.  Ever since she entered into this business the results have been very good, since the business has been well received in her community.

At this time, Ana Gabriela is requesting a loan of 300,000 Costa Rican colones to buy clothing for women, men and children so that she will have inventory to sell.  This way she can increase her financial resources and provide for her 8 year-old daughter.

Ana Gabriela is a member of the communal bank of Guaitil S. A.  She feels very grateful for having the opportunity to access credit in this way, so that she can reach her goals in life.

loans.use: to buy clothing for men, women and children to sell

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
La señora Raquel se dedica al perifoneo y su herramienta principal es su automóvil, pero su auto se descompuso y ya no quiso funcionar, por eso esta solicitando un crédito con nosotros para comprar un nuevo carro.
La señora Raquel tiene 25 años dedicándose al perifoneo, trabajo con el cual puede solventar los gastos de la casa ya que al estar separada su trabajo es fundamenta para pagar los gastos de la casa. La señora Raquel tiene 3 hijos los cuales aun están en etapa escolar y por quienes se esfuerza para darles lo mejor cada día.
texts.en:
Raquel works doing loudspeaker announcements. Her main piece of equipment is her vehicle, however, it broke down and will not function anymore. This is why she is requesting a loan with us to purchase a new car.

Raquel has worked doing loudspeaker announcements for 25 years. Her work allows her to pay for household expenses. Now that she is unable to work, it is essential in order to pay for the household expenses. Raquel is has three children who are school aged. She tries hard every day to give them the best.

loans.use: to buy a car to work doing loudspeaker announcements.

loans.name: Adrian De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Adrian es un hombre de 20 años de edad y vive con su familia, en una comunidad de la zona Sur de Costa Rica, ubicada en Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas. La economía local está basada en actividades agropecuarias, donde destaca la siembra de tubérculos, café, maíz, frijoles y ganadería.
Adrian está solicitando un préstamo de ₡400.000 (cuatrocientos mil colones), para darle mantenimiento a su siembra por medio de abono y fungicidas para proteger sus cultivos de semillas de frijol, ya que es una alternativa fiable y sostenible. Con estos abonos, Adrian aumentara la capacidad que posee el suelo de absorber los distintos elementos nutritivos y con los fungicidas que utilizara gracias a este préstamo también evitara que aparezcan hongos en sus plantaciones, para que al ingerirlos sus clientes no corran peligro de adquirir alguna enfermedad. 
Y así brindara productos de calidad a sus clientes, alcanzara la meta de venta que se ha propuesto para cada mes. Y además dará a abasto con todas sus obligaciones y pagos para así sacar adelante a su numerosa familia.
Adrian es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal denla Danta S.A, una de las 150 empresas de crédito comunal de Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Adrian is a 20-year-old man living with his family in a community in the south of Costa Rica located in Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas.  The local economy is based on animal husbandry activities where tuber, coffee, corn and bean farming and livestock raising predominate.

Adrian has requested a ₡400.000 (four-hundred thousand colones) loan to provide crop maintenance via manure and fungicides to protect his bean seeds since they are as sustainable, reliable alternative.  With the manure, Adrian will increase his soil’s capacity to absorb various nutrients and with the fungicide he’ll use thanks to this loan he will prevent fungus from arising in his plants so that when customers ingest them they will be safe from acquiring any illness and thus provide quality products to his customers and reach his monthly sales target.  Besides, he will meet all his obligations and payments to move his large family forward.

Adrian is a member of the Danta S.A. communal bank, one of 150 communal credit firms in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy manure and fungicide.

loans.name: Marisa

texts.es: Marisa de 28 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos a su cargo. Reside en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, ubicada en la localidad de Comumpiari, donde tiene su techo propio. Hace 06 meses que Marisa empezó en la venta de bebidas como: gaseosas y refrescos; sus principales clientes son la gente de su localidad y la gente que llega a conocer el pueblo de Comumpiari. Gracias a este negocio puede solventar con los gastos escolares de sus hijos ya que es padre y madre para sus queridos hijos. Ahora bien establecida en su negocio anhela ampliar su tienda introduciendo nuevos productos, pero en mayores proporciones, para que así los venda al por mayor y menor. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que la gente le da ánimos para que pueda seguir adelante y considera que lo mas difícil es cuando se le agotan las bebidas; por ello acude a los financistas para solicitar un préstamo que le ayude a trabajar tranquilamente y poder solventar a sus hijos.  Este será su crédito número 01 con MFP, lo cual se siente agradecida con la institución, por la oportunidad que le brindan, por lo que se compromete en cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas. Con el crédito solicitado de 1,500 nuevos soles, piensa invertir en la compra de más productos de primera necesidad, con la finalidad de que surta su tienda.
texts.en:
Marisa, 28, is a single mother; she has three children in her care.  She lives in the beautiful Ayacucho jungle in the community of Comumpiari where she owns her house.  Six months ago Marisa started to sell beverages like soft-drinks and sodas.  Her main customers are people from her community and people who come to visit the town of Comumpiari.  Thanks to this business she can cover her children’s educational costs since she’s both mother and father to her beloved children.

She’s now well-established in her business and would like to expand the store introducing new products but in larger amounts so that she can sell at both wholesale and retail.  What she most likes about her work is that the people encourage her to continue forward and she considers the most difficult part of it running out of beverages.  This is why she calls on lenders to request a loan that will help her work with tranquility and to be able to support her children.

This will be her first MFP loan.  She  is grateful to the institution for the opportunity it provides her and she commits to meet her installments.  She will use the requested 1500 new soles to buy more staple items to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy stock staple merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Huancarani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “HUANCARANI” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Patacamaya, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Zonia. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: producción de leche, tejido a mano, transportista.

La señora Zonia  indica que es la primera vez que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de producción de leche que viene trabajando hace años atrás, aprendiendo el mismo de sus padres.

El préstamo que sacará es para la compra de forraje para su ganado y posteriormente comercializará la leche en su comunidad. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el crédito ágil.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Huancarani" will take it's first loan with Pro Mujer as part of regional office at Patacamaya. It is made up of ten member and is led by a board of directors headed by Zonia. The communal bank members' businesses are varied. Among them are milk production, hand weaving and transportation.

Zonia notes that it is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer. She joined the institution through the invitation of a salesperson. Currently, she has a businesses in milk production, which she has worked at for years. She learned the business from her parents.

The loan that she will take is to buy feed for her livestock and then sell the milk in her community. This type of work allows her to generate an income to support her family, as she is married and has 5 children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training and the flexible loans.

loans.use: to buy feed.

loans.name: Lourdes Piedad

texts.es:
Lourdes es una mujer de 37 años, es muy trabajadora y responsable. Vive en Ambato Princia de Tungurahua, en la Zona centro de Ecuador. Lourdes es una persona sola no tiene hijos ni esposo.

Lourdes es una mujer agricultora, se dedica a esta labor desde hace mucho tiempo con ayuda de sus padres. Es el segundo crédito que realiza a Fodemi, el mismo que va a invertir en la compra de abonos y remedios para su terreno ya que por la mala temporada los cultivos se dañan y necesita cuidar la producción de remolacha, esta inversión junto con el cuidado de su cultivo ayudará a Lourdes a obtener buenos ingresos y con esto mejorar su calidad de vida.

Su sueño es poder obtener buenos ingresos para poder seguir cultivando sus tierras.
texts.en:
Lourdes is a 37-year-old, very hardworking, responsible woman.  She lives in Amato Princia de Tungurahua in central Ecuador.  Lourdes is an individual person; she has neither children nor husband.  Lourdes is a farmer.  She’s been in this line of work for a long time with help from her parents.  

This is her second Fodemi loan and she will use it to buy manure and remedies for her soil because the poor seasons have damaged crops and she needs to care for her beet crops.  This investment added to the crop care will help Lourdes to earn good income and with it to improve her quality of life.  Her dream is to earn good income to continue farming her land.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Mauricia

texts.es: Mauricia de 62 años de edad, esposa de Guillermo de 65 años, fruto de ese amor tiene a su único hijo que se quedo junto a ella  y viven en su propia casa. Para Mauricia su único objetivo es salir adelante; de niña empezó a estar metida en la chacra de sus padres, lo ayudaba sin cesar, y de jovencita ella vendía los productos que cosechaban sus padres y ganaba sus primeras propinas;  hoy tiene su propio terreno de cultivo, específicamente en la producción de Cacao, por el cual agradece profundamente a sus padres por el apoyo y las enseñanzas que lo dieron durante su permanencia; a ella le encanta trabajar. Mauricia se levanta muy temprano para preparar el desayuno, una vez terminado con sus quehaceres se va a su chacra, conjuntamente con su esposo, desde muy temprano hasta el atardecer del día, casi todos los días de la semana, solo que ocasionalmente los Domingos deja de laboral para cuidar a su hijo que es un joven invalido. Regularme su producto los vende en los Centros de Acopio de su comunidad, en efecto adquiere buenas ganancias, con la finalidad de que pueda cubrir su canasta familiar. En el futuro quiere ampliar su terreno de cultivo con el propósito de producir en grande cantidades y venderlos a precio de mercado. Este es su crédito numero 03 con MFP, por lo que se compromete a cumplir fielmente con sus obligaciones de pago, además agradece a su banco comunal por la buena dirección que deciden. Con el dinero solicitado de 2,000 nuevos soles, invertirá en el mantenimiento idóneo de su terreno de cultivo como desyerbar y comprar abono, para que así prevenga riesgos que puedan contaminar su producto.
texts.en:
Muricia, 62, is Guillermo’s, 65, wife.  Her only son lives with her in their own house.  Mauricia’s only objective is to get ahead.  She started helping out in her parents’ fields when she was still a little girl.  She’d help them unceasingly and as a young girl would help them sell the products her parents harvested and started earning her first tips.  Today, she has her own field specifically used to grow cocoa beans that she profoundly thanks her parents for the support and knowledge they gave her while still here; she loves to work.

Mauricia rises very early to prepare breakfast and when she finishes her household chores she heads out to her fields with her husband working from very early until nightfall almost every day of the week although on Sundays she occasionally stops working to care for her son who is an invalid.

She normally sells her crops to the local gathering center and earns good profits actually to be able to buy basic family staples.  In the future, she’d like to expand her field to grow larger amounts to be sold at market prices.

This is MFP loan #3 that she commits to repay faithfully.  She thanks her communal bank for the good direction they decide on.  She will use the requested 2000 new soles to invest in the maintenance that’s fit for her type of soil like weeding and buying manure to prevent risks that could contaminate her products.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure and to hire day laborers.

loans.name: Octavia

texts.es: Octavia de 38 años de edad, convive con Revelino de 32 años; viven en su propia casa junto a su pequeña hija Yaneri de 04 años a quien desea un mejor futuro. A Octavia siempre le ha gustado ser diferente a sus demás competencias, en cuanto precio, calidad y de buen servicio atención hacia sus clientes. Hace 20 años que se ha dedicado al cultivo de cacao, se siente muy contenta con lo que  ha logrado, ya que aspira en grandes cosas como de extender sus plantaciones en otra zonas estratégicas, para que así de la misma chacra venda su producto a los mayoristas y así minimizar el traslado de producto. Cada mañana se despierta con las mismas ganas de siempre, y conjuntamente con su pareja se dirigen a su centro de laborales, para el cuidado respectivo de su terreno de cultivo. Por lo general trabajan durante todo el día, y solo los fines de semana descansan y se dedican de lleno a su hija, pero en tiempo de vacaciones le brinda su ayuda. En temporadas de acopio tiene a cargo de sus peones que le puedan facilitar en un menor tiempo posible. Este será su crédito número 03 con MFP, por el cual se compromete a cumplir con sus respectivos pagos en fechas oportunas, además agradece a su banco comunal, por la transparencia y veracidad que lo ejercen. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles; podrá realizar el  mantenimiento  de su terreno de cultivo, desyerbando y fertilizando con la finalidad de mejorar su cosecha en futuros meses.
texts.en:
Octavia, 38, lives with Revelino, 32, in their own house with their 4-year-old daughter, Yaneri, that she wants a better future for.  Octavia has always liked to be different from her competition with respect to price, quality and customer service.  She’s been farming cocoa beans for 20 years and feels happy with her accomplishments since she aspires to great things like expanding her plantations into other strategic locations to sell her harvests from her fields direct to wholesalers thus minimizing product transportation.

Every morning she awakens with the same energy and together with her spouse they head for their worksite to care for their field.  In general, they work all day and only rest on weekends which they dedicate completely to their daughter although during vacation periods she helps her out.  During harvest season, she hires day laborers to bring in the harvest in the shortest possible time.

This will be MFP loan #3 and she commits to be punctual with her installment payments.  She’s grateful to her communal bank for the transparency and honesty they operate with.  She will use the requested 3000 new soles to provide crop maintenance .  She will weed and fertilize to improve the harvest in future months.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to hire day laborers.

loans.name: Lucrecia Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Lucrecia es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de 51 años de edad propietaria de un pequeño taller de costura donde su especialidad son los delantales y gabachas. Este negocio lo inicio hace aproximadamente 20 años con el propósito de salir adelante, con el crédito ella comprara materia prima telas, hilos, cintas y bordados.
Ella tiene tres hijos dos de ellos ya mayores y una menor de 20 años la cual esta en la universidad.
texts.en: Lucrecia is a hardworking, enterprising, 51-year-old woman who owns a small sewing shop where her specialty is aprons and chef jackets.  She started the business 20 years ago hoping to get ahead.  She will use the loan to buy raw materials: fabric, thread, ribbon and appliqués.  She has three children.  Two of them are adults and one is 20 years old and attending university.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Amor Group

texts.es:
El grupo Amor lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Dominga de 42 años quien se dedica al comercio de frutas y verduras desde hace 8 años en el mercado más populoso de Managua. Ella tiene tres hijos de los cuales solo el menor de 9 años esta a su cargo e invertirá el crédito en el negocio.
Los otros integrantes del grupo son Wilber Antonio de 29 años quien vende ropa desde hace 4 años y Mercedes Patricia de 30 años quien distribuye productos Avon desde hace 6 años.
texts.en:
The “Amor” (Love) group is composed of three hardworking, enterprising people.  One of them is Dominga, 42, who has been a fruit and vegetable merchant for 8 years in Managua’s biggest market.  She has three children but only her youngest, a nine-year-old, is still in her care.  She will invest the loan in her business.

The other group members are: Wilber Antonio, 29, who has sold clothes for four years and Mercedes Patricia, 30, who has been selling Avon products for six years.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables harvested in season

loans.name: Las Azucenas Group

texts.es:
El grupo la Azucenas está conformado por seis personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras. La coordinadora del grupo  es María del Socorro de 24 años quien se dedica a la venta de carne y hueso desde hace 5 años junto a su hermana. Ella invertirá el crédito en carne, hueso, hígado, corazón…etc.
Las otras integrantes son Ana María  de 39 años quien se dedica a la venta de tortilla y leña desde hace 4 años, Consuelo de 56 años comenzó realizando tortillas ahora vende arroz de leche y cajetas, Dielka vende nacatamales, Esmeralda tiene una tortillería y Urania vende ropa.
texts.en: The communal bank "Las Azucenas" is comprised of 6 hardworking and enterprising individuals.  The coordinator for this group is María del Socorro, 24, who has had a business selling meat and bones with her sister for 5 years.  She will invest this loan in meat, bones, and offal such as cow heart and liver.  The other members of this group are Ana Maria, 39, who's had a business selling tortillas and firewood for 4 years, Consuelo, 56, who started out making tortillas and now sells rice pudding and caramel, Dielka, who sells nacatamales (traditional, large Nicaraguan tamales), Esmeralda, who makes tortillas, and Urania, who sells clothing.

loans.use: to buy meat and bones

loans.name: Amalia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Amalia del Carmen es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora propietaria de una panadería. Este negocio lo inicio su papá quien al morir ella junto a su esposo y mamá siguió con el negocio. 
El cual en estos ocho años se ha ido desarrollando ampliamente ahora venden mayor cantidad de producto. Ella invertirá el crédito en materia prima harina, azúcar, moldes…etc.
texts.en:
Amalia del Carmen is a hardworking and enterprising woman who owns a bakery. Her father started the business and when he died, she, together with her husband and her mother, continued running it.

The business has expanded a great deal during these eight years and they now sell a greater variety of products. Amalia will invest the loan in basic materials such as flour, sugar, molds…etc.

loans.use: to buy basic supplies: flour, sugar, molds....etc.

loans.name: Idalia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Idalia del Rosario es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de 42 años quien desde hace 5 años continuó con la pequeña venta de su madre, además de ello comercializa ropa, sandalias y productos Avon. Ella invertirá el crédito en mercadería especial ropa, calzado y granos básicos. 
Idalia tiene un hijo de 17 años el cual se ha acaba de bachillerar lo cual fue muy emotivo para ella y su meta es seguir trabajando y apoyar a su hijo en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Idalia del Rosario is an enterprising and hardworking woman, aged 42, who has been continuing with her mother’s small grocery business. In addition she also sells clothing, sandals and Avon products. She will invest the loan in merchandise, especially clothing, footwear and bulk grains.

Idalia has a 17 year old daughter who has just graduated high school, which was a very emotional experience for her. Her goal is to continue working and supporting her daughter in her studies.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes and bulk grains.

loans.name: Urania

texts.es:
Urania Jalina es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora la cual tiene una pequeña venta. Este negocio lo inicio hace 11 años con pocos productos actualmente tiene un negocio mas grande el cual sueña en que sea una gran distribuidora. 
Ella con el crédito anterior logro mejorar su negocio y realizar un anexo en la casa. Este crédito lo necesita para invertir en granos básicos, carne…etc.
texts.en:
Urania Jalina is an enterprising and hardworking woman who owns a small grocery store. She started this business 11 years ago with few products on the shelves. Currently she has a bigger business and she dreams of becoming a large distributor.

With the previous loan, she succeeded in expanding her business and adding an extension to her house. She needs this loan to invest in bulk grains, meat…etc.

loans.use: to buy bulk grains, meat...etc.

loans.name: Reseda Group

texts.es:
El grupo Reseda lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras la coordinadora es María Isabel de 42 años quien realiza bordados y elabora bolsos típicos. Ella tiene tres hijos de 19, 18 y 7 años los dos menores estudian. 
Ella invertirá el crédito en cuerina y tela, accesorios…etc. para su negocio.
Las otras integrantes son María Dolores quien realiza artesanías desde hace 10 años y Julia de 33 años quien trabaja en bordados desde hace 1 año.
texts.en:
The Reseda Group is made up of three hard-working and enterprising women, coordinated by 42 year old María Isabel who does needlework and embroiders traditional bags. She has three children aged 19, 18 and 7, of whom the youngest two are in education.


She will invest the loan in fabric, threads and accessories etc for her business.

The other members are María Dolores who has been making handicrafts for 10 years and 33 year old Julia who has been working in needlework for 1 year.

loans.use: to buy fabric, threads, etc.

loans.name: Las Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Luchadoras lo conforman cuatro personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es María Nela de 27 años quien vende ropa, calzado, cremas, perfumes…etc. desde hace 7 años, ella es casada y tiene tres hijos de 5, 6 y 9 años por los cuales trabaja arduamente con el sueño de que ellos se preparen. El crédito lo invertirá en material escolar ya que viene la temporada escolar.
Las otras integrantes son Maribel quien comercializa productos de plata, Nohemi vende ropa y Mercedes vende ropa.
texts.en:
The Las Luchadores group is made up of four hard-working and enterprising people. 

One of them is 27 year old María Nela who has been selling clothes, shoes, lotions, perfumes, etc for 7 years. She is married and has three children aged 5, 6 and 9. She works hard for them as she dreams that they will be able to study.

She will invest the loan in school supplies as the school season is beginning.

The other members are Maribel who sells silver products and Nohemi and Mercedes who sell clothes.

loans.use: to buy school supplies for the season.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: La señora María es  una persona  trabajadora  y muy responsable,  la  cual  tiene un negocio de venta de ropa usada, el cual  le a permitido  salir  adelante  día  con día,  en esta ocasión requiere  de nuestro  apoyo para  realizar  la compra  de mercancía  para  continuar  trabajando, agradece  el  apoyo  brindado para la  realización de su proyecto ya que  ve  en  el crédito la posibilidad  de  brindar  a  sus  clientes  un excelente  servicio, además  de  generar  mayores  ingresos.
texts.en:
María is a hard-working and very resposible person. She has her own business selling used clothes, which allows her to succeed day to day. 

On this occasion she needs our help to be able to buy merchandise so she can continue working.

In the support offered to help her realise her goals, allows her the possibility to offer excellent service to her customers as well as generating more income.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Johnny De Las Piedades

texts.es:
Johnny es un hombre de 35 años de edad y vive con su familia, en una comunidad de la zona Sur de Costa Rica, ubicada en Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas. La economía local está basada en actividades agropecuarias, donde destaca la siembra de tubérculos, café, maíz, frijoles y ganadería.

Johnny está solicitando un préstamo de ₡150.000 (ciento cincuenta mil colones), para darle mantenimiento a su siembra por medio de abono y fungicidas e insecticidas, para proteger sus cultivos de semillas de frijol, ya que es una alternativa fiable y sostenible. Con estos abonos, Diego aumentara la capacidad que posee el suelo de absorber los distintos elementos nutritivos y con los fungicidas que utilizara gracias a este préstamo también evitara que aparezcan hongos en sus plantaciones, para que al ingerirlos sus clientes no corran peligro de adquirir alguna enfermedad. 

Y así brindara productos de calidad a sus clientes, alcanzara la meta de venta que se ha propuesto para cada mes. Y además dará a abasto con todas sus obligaciones y pagos para así sacar adelante a su numerosa familia.

Johnny es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal denla Danta S.A, una de las 150 empresas de crédito comunal de Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Johnny is a man of 35, and lives with his family in Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas, a community in the southern area of Costa Rica. The local economy is based on agriculture, particularly the growing of tubers, coffee, corn, beans, as well as livestock-raising. 

Johnny is applying for a loan of 150,000 colones, in order to maintain his plantings by means of organic fertilizer, fungicides, and insecticides. This will protect his bean crops, as it is a reliable and sustainable alternative.

With these fertilizers, Johnny will increase the soil's capacity to absorb the various nutritional elements, and with the fungicides that he will use thanks to this loan, he wll also avoid fungi appearing in his plantings. This way, when ingesting them, his customers don't run the risk of acquiring some illness. 

In this way he will provide quality products to his customers, and reach the sales goal that he has set himself for each month. 

Besides, he will be able to cope with all his obligations and payments and help his numerous family get ahead in life. Johnny is a member of the Empresa Comunal Denia Danta S.A, one of the 150 communal banks in Costa Rica.

loans.use: To buy fungicides and insecticides.

loans.name: Maria Raquel

texts.es:
Maria Raquel  vive en Ica ,ciudad caracterizada actualmente por el incremento de inversión, no solo en la agroexporaciones, es decir en los fundos, si no también, en la apertura de nuevos centros comerciales que brindan muchos puestos de trabajo a pobladores iqueños;  como bien se sabe el Perú se caracteriza por tener las comidas más deliciosas del mundo y uno de los platillos que más le agrada es “Carapulcra con Sopa Seca”  Maria Raquel estudió hasta quinto grado de primaria y l hubiera gustado estudiar para ser profesora, tienen 4 hijos todos ellos han terminado de estudiar en nivel superior.	

"Maria Raquel se dedica al Venta de Comida junto a la ayuda de su pareja; ofrece diversos platillos de la exquisita comida peruana, aproximadamente  se dedica a u negocio 3 horas diarias, y se animo gracias a la iniciativa de una de sus amigas.  En un día Maria Raquel puede atender diariamente un promedio de 45 clientes y esto le permite ganar aproximadamente un promedio de S/. 250 diarios y en un buen día puede ganar S/. 300,  lo que le ayuda en algunos gastos adicionales del hogar, ella cree que su negocio tiene éxito debido lo rico que prepara los platillos  y por la amabilidad en el trato a los clientes. 

Maria  agradece  mucho a los prestatarios Kiva ya que con el apoyo brindado Maria va  remodelar  y comprar  más utensilios para su cocina. Esta mejora podrá ayudarla a realizar su trabajo de manera mas cómoda y con mejores utensilios para la preparación de los platillos y así poder en algunos meses Tener más clientela y con los ingresos juntar el dinero para poder cumplir uno de sus más grandes sueños: “Tener un restaurante propio”.
texts.en:
Maria Raquel lives in Ica, a city currently characterized by increased investment, not only in exports of agricultural products, that is to say financing these, but also in the opening of new retail centers that provide many jobs to people living in Ica.  As is well known, Perú is noted for having some of the most delicious food in the world, and one of the most pleasing dishes is Carapulcra con Sopa Seca (a spicy potato-based stew served with green noodles).

Maria Raquel went to school as far as fifth grade of primary, and would have liked to study to be a teacher. They have four children, all of whom have completed post-secondary studies.

Maria Raquel sells food with the help of her partner. She offers various dishes of exquisite Peruvian food. She works at her business approximately three hours daily, and was encouraged because of the initiative of one of her friends. 

In a day, Maria Raquel can serve an average of 45 customers, and this allows her to earn, on average, approximately 250 soles per day; on a good day she can earn 300 soles. This helps her meet a few additional household expenses. She thinks her business is succesful because of how delicious her dishes are, and the friendly way she serves her customers.  

Maria really appreciates the Kiva lenders, since with the support she has been provided, Maria is going to renovate and buy more utensils for her kitchen. 

This improvement will help her carry out her work more comfortably, and with better utensils for preparing dishes. This way she will be able to have more customers in a few months, and with the income, raise money to fulfil one of her greatest dreams, "To have my own restaurant."

loans.use: To buy cooking utensils, and improve her kitchen.

loans.name: Roxana Edith

texts.es:
Roxana Edith  en una mujer emprendedora , que no se deja vencer ante nada, vive en Ica, ciudad caracterizada actualmente por el incremento de inversión, no solo en la agroexporaciones, es decir en los fundos, si no también, en la apertura de nuevos centros comerciales que brindan muchos puestos de trabajo a pobladores iqueños.  En su tiempo libre disfruta de una buena lectura o ver en la televisión sus programas favoritos;  como bien se sabe el Perú se caracteriza por tener las comidas más deliciosas del mundo y uno de los platos que más le agrada  a Roxana Edith  es la “Carapulcra con Sopa Seca”. Roxana  es profesora pero le hubiera gustado estudiar  Ciencias de la comunicación; es Casada, su esposo es conductor de mototaxi y juntos tienen 3 hijos que  comprenden las edades de  4, 10 y 16 años, el menor de ellos se encuentra en nivel inicial, el segundo de sus hijos se encuentra en quinto de primaria y el mayor se encuentra en quinto de secundaria.

Roxana se dedica a la Venta de ropa y ofrece sus productos a las amas de casa de su barrio y a sus compañeras de la escuela donde tambien trabaja, se dedica a este negocio aproximadamente  2 horas diarias, quien incentivo a Roxana para que emprendiera en este negocio fue su esposo ya que vio en ella habilidad para la este tipo de negocio.
 
En un día atiende un promedio de 2 clientes y esto le permite ganar aproximadamente un promedio de S/. 75 diarios y en un buen día puede ganar S/. 100 soles lo que le ayuda en algunos gastos adicionales del hogar, su negocio tiene éxito ya que ella brinda un trato amable y su clientes la recomienda por el buen servicio que ofrece. Actualmente está muy agradecida con  los prestatarios Kiva ya que con este apoyo podrá  comprar más ropa para su negocio y tener más variedad de prendas.

Esta mejora podrá ayudarle a tener más variedad de prendas que ofrecer y con ello aumentaría sus ventas y de esta manera tendría mas ingresos y así poder en algunos meses tener un automóvil pero el sueño más grande que Roxana tiene y que anhela mucho es: “ Darle una buena educación  a sus hijos para que sean profesionales de éxito y tener una boutique para la venta de ropa y una empresa de transporte."
texts.en:
Roxana Edith is an enterprising woman who does not give up when faced with a problem. She lives in Ica, a city currently characterized by increased investment, not only in the sector of food exports, i.e. in farms, but also in the opening of new shopping centers which offer many jobs to residents of Ica. In her spare time Roxana enjoys a good book or watches her favorite TV programs. It is well known that Peru has the most delicious food in the world. One of Roxana's favorite dishes is "Carapulcra con Sopa Seca", a typical dish of southern Peru, made from pork, groundnuts, potatoes, noodles and chicken. Roxana is a teacher, but communication science is what she would have liked to study. She is married and her husband drives a motor taxi. They have three children, aged 4, 10 and 16. Their youngest child goes to kindergarten, their second one is in fifth grade of elementary school and the eldest in fifth grade of secondary school.

Roxana sells clothes to housewives in her neighborhood and to her colleagues at the school where she works. She spends approximately two hours a day with this activity. Roxana got the incentive to launch this business from her husband who had noticed her skill with this kind of activity.

On an average day she serves two customers, which gives her an average income of 75 new soles per day. On a good day she can earn 100 new soles, which helps her to pay for additional household expenditures. Her business is successful because she is friendly with her customers who recommend her for her good service. She is very grateful to Kiva lenders because this loan enables her to buy additional clothes for her business and have a greater product range on offer. 

This improvement will help Roxana to have more variety of clothes to offer and thus more sales and more income. In a few months she could have a car. However, her biggest dreams are to provide her children with a good education, so that they may become successful professionals, as well as to own a boutique for her clothing business and a transportation company.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (clothes).

loans.name: Daniel Augusto

texts.es:
Daniel Augusto vive en Ica, ciudad caracterizada actualmente por el incremento de inversión, no solo en la agroexporaciones, es decir en los fundos, si no también, en la apertura de nuevos centros comerciales que brindan muchos puestos de trabajo a pobladores iqueños;  como bien se sabe el Perú se caracteriza por tener las comidas más deliciosas del mundo y uno de los platos que a Daniel Augusto le agrada mucho son los "Frejoles con Seco". Daniel Augusto estudió hasta quinto de secundaria pero le hubiera gustado estudiar  Mecánica. 

Daniel Augusto es casado, su esposa se dedica al hogar, juntos tienen 4 hijos sus hijos cuyas edades son 1 mes, 3, 8, 20 años.” Daniel Augusto se dedica a la compra y venta de fruta ambulante en su triciclo por las calles de la ciudad, se dedica a este trabajo todo el día, se animo el mismo. En un día Daniel Augusto es una persona luchadora, optimista y constante puede atender hasta  50 clientes aproximadamente y esto le permite ganar aproximadamente un promedio de S/. 50 diarios y en un buen día puede ganar hasta S/. 70 lo que le ayuda en algunos gastos adicionales del hogar, el cree que el éxito de su negocio es porque atiende a los clientes de manera amable y cordial. Actualmente agradece a los  prestatarios Kiva por apoyarlo en la compra de muebles y camas para su hogar ya que sus hijos no tienen donde dormir.

Esta mejora  lo ayudara a  darles comodidad y una mejor calidad de vida para ellos, que son su motor para salir adelante día a día; pero Daniel por ser una persona que no se rinde va a luchar para poder cumplir el mayor de sus sueños: “ Tener una casa propia para su familia."
texts.en:
Daniel Augusto lives in Ica, a city currently characterized by increased investment not only in the agricultural sector, ie on the farms, but also with the opening of new shopping centers that provide jobs for many residents of Ica. As is commonly known, Peru is known for the most delicious meals in the world and one of the dishes that Daniel Augustus likes very much is "Beans with Cilantro Beef Stew." Daniel Augusto studied up to fifth grade in school but would have liked to have studied to be a mechanic.

Daniel Augusto is married. His wife takes care of the household. Together they have 4 children who are 1 month, 3, 8 and 20 years old. Daniel Augusto buys and sells fruit from his tricycle as he walks the streets of the city. He does this all day and he encourages himself to do so. In the space of a day, Daniel Augusto, who is a determined, optimistic and constant person, can serve up to about 50 customers which allows him to earn about S/. 50 (PEN) a day and on a good day up to S/. 70 (PEN) which helps him with a few of the additional household expenses. He believes that his business' success is due to the fact that he serves his customers in a friendly and polite manner. Currently, he is grateful to the Kiva borrowers for helping him with the purchase of furniture and beds for his home as his children have nowhere to sleep.

This improvement will help him give them a comfortable and better quality of life. They are his driving force to get ahead day by day but Daniel being a person who never gives up will fight to achieve his biggest dream: "Having a home of his own for his family."

loans.use: to buy beds and furniture.

loans.name: Azim

texts.ru: Азим еще молод, но уже работает пастухом. Он пасет стадо овец и коз своего поселка.  Азиму 27 лет, он женат и имеет 2 детей. Жена нигде не работает и занимается домашним хозяйством. Азим живет со своими родителями. Старший брат находится в России, присылает своей семье деньги. Азим кроме того что пасет стадо других людей, занимается разведением своего скота с детства. Кроме того он покупает и разводит скот для получения дополнительного дохода и занялся этим 10 лет назад. Сейчас его стадо находиться в горах и пасется. Азим хочет получить кредит для покупки мелкого рогатого скота - коз и запаса корма для них. Это его первый кредит.
texts.en: Azim is still young, but is already working as a shepherd.  He takes care of a herd of sheep and goats from his village.  Azim is 27 years old, married and has two children.  His wife does not work and is involved in household work.  Azim lives with his parents.  His oldest brother is in Russia and sends money to his family.  Besides taking other people's herds to pasture, Azim has been involved in breeding his own livestock since childhood.  In addition, he buys and breeds livestock for making a supplemental income and has been in this business for ten years.  Currently, his herd is at a pasture in the mountains.  Azim wants to obtain this loan to purchase small livestock - goats and to stock up on fodder for them.  This is his first loan.

loans.use: to purchase small livestock and fodder

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is married and has eight children ranging from 13 to 32 years old. She describes herself as an honest and go-getter woman. She runs a grocery store and has sold kale, tomatoes, bananas, carrots, etc., for the last two years. 

Her business is faced with the problem of inadequate funds to expand the grocery store. She will use the loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings to buy potatoes and carrots. Esther hopes and dreams to be a supplier and increase the number of her customers in the next five years.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes and carrots.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married and has four children ranging from 5 to 16 years old. She describes herself as a social and industrious woman. She is involved in a furniture making activity. She has been in this business for the last 10 years and has two employees. She sells furniture such as beds, cupboards, sofa sets and chairs. Her business challenges are the shortage of timber and inadequate funds. 

She will use the loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy timber and wood varnish. Mary's hope and dream is to increase her amount of customers in the next five years.

loans.use: To buy timber and wood varnish.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan, 36 years old, is a single mother with three children ranging from five months to 21 years old. She describes herself as an efficient and hardworking woman. She sells medicine and provides maternity services to frequent customers. She has one employee and has been in this business for seven years. Her business challenge is insufficient funds for improving the pharmacy. She will use this loan of KES 20,000 to buy more medicine. Susan dreams of expanding her business and hopes that it will be the most preferred among the others by the customers in the area.

loans.use: to buy more medicine.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 29 years old, and married. She has two children, aged five and ten years. She describes herself as an intelligent woman. She has been selling spare parts to motor vehicle owners for two years. She has one employee. The business is located within the town area. Beatrice face a challenge of a shortage of spare parts. She will be using this loan of KES 20,000 to add to the stock of spare parts. In the future, Beatrice hopes to be a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo is a married man with four children, living in the town of Talibon, Bohol. He sells firewood for a living. Danilo has been in this kind of business for quite some time now. He also tills a parcel of land where he grows rice. Danilo's harvest is for his family's consumption.

Danilo has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers and more firewood to sell. Danilo hopes his business will grow. He also hopes to acquire a bigger piece of land for farming.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and more firewood to sell.

loans.name: Thua

texts.en: Mrs. Thua is requesting this loan for her daughter, a first-year university student studying to become an accountant. After her five years of university, she hopes to work for the accounting department of a joint venture company near her house. Now studying hard to reach her goal, she needs 14,580,000 Vietnam dong to pay for tuition fees, books, and supplies.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's tuition fees, books, and supplies.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is a 32-year-old married man with 2 children, aged 4 and 2. He has had a tricycle taxi business for more than 5 years. Joel earns about 5,000 PHP per month with his business. He is able to provide for his family's needs with his current income.

Joel has requested this loan to purchase tires, chain and other tricycle parts. Joel hopes to earn better and be able to save for his children's education and house renovation.

loans.use: to purchase tires, chain and other tricycle parts.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en: Bernard is 30 years old, married, and has a seven-year-old daughter. He describes himself as an honest man. He has been running a poultry activity for the last two years.  He sells eggs and chickens. He has one employee and his business challenge is inadequate funds. He will use the loan of 10,000 KES to buy more chickens. Bernard hopes and dreams to build a permanent coop for his poultry in the next five years.

loans.use: To buy more chickens.

loans.name: Tho

texts.en: Tho is taking the loan out for her daughter, Luyen, who is attending Hung yen University for Technical training. Her course lasts 5 years and it will be completed by 2014. Luyen wants to be an English teacher or translator, so she is studying very hard and trying to overcome difficulties to obtain good results. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 14,580,000 Vietnam dong to pay for tuition fees and buy supplies for studying.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's tuition fees and buy supplies for her studies.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is a 56-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She and her husband have been running a fishing business for 20 years. She said their recent income is 5,000 PHP per month. She does her best to improve their business and sustain her family.

She requested this loan to purchase a fishing boat and nets. This will help her expand their business. In the future, Paulina hopes to have a bigger business and successful children.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat and nets.

loans.name: Le

texts.en: Le is taking the loan out for her son, Son. With the hope of being a business administrator for a company, Son entered Hanoi Polytechnic University.  His course lasts 5 years, and it will be completed by September, 2014. During studying, he has difficulties in paying fees and managing daily expenses since he is living far from home.
