La ciudad, junto con otros cerca de la costa del Pacífico, fue dañado durante el 2001 y 2007 terremotos Perú, pero ha soportado como lo ha hecho durante gran parte de su historia..  En su tiempo libre disfruta;  como bien se sabe el Perú se caracteriza por tener las comidas más deliciosas del mundo y uno de los platos que a Carlos le gusta mucho es “Carapulcra con sopa seca”. Carlos estudió hasta tercer año de secundaria pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Mecánica. Carlos es soltero y trabaja en su negocio de vidriería , el se dedica a este trabajo 12 horas diarias.

En un día Carlos puede atender  de 2 a 3 clientes diariamente, ya que depende de los pedidos que le realicen y esto le permite ganar aproximadamente un promedio de hasta S/. 100 diarios y en un buen día puede ganar hasta S/. 200 lo que le ayuda en algunos gastos adicionales, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es puntual en la entrega de los pedidos que le hacen y por la calidad y la buena atención hacia los clientes. 

Carlos esta muy agradecido con la ayuda otorgada por los prestatarios Kiva, ya que con este apoyo el podra comprar mas mercadería para su negocio. Esta mejora le ayudara en aumentar su inventario y seguir dando buena atención y así poder en algunos meses ampliar su local y tener mas variedad de productos lo que le generara mas ganancias y con ello lo ayudará a cumplir su gran sueño: “Comprar una camioneta".
texts.en:
Carlos Yubani is 21 years old and lives in Mala, a city located about an hour and a half to the south of Lima.  Mala, with its sandy beaches, pre-Incan ruins, and the production of Perú's nationally-adored liquor, Pisco (a type of hard liquor made from grapes), has been a tourist destination for wealthy Peruvians for a long time.  But the authentic city of Cañete is warm and peaceful with a large Afro-Peruvian population, the remains of an indigenous pathway, and the influences of the Spanish empire.  The city, along with others along the Pacific coast, was damaged in 2001 and 2007 as a result of earhquakes which occurred in those years, but has continued on as it has always done through its history.  In his free time he enjoys himself; it is well-known that Perú is recognized for having the most delicious food in the world and one of the dishes that Carlos likes a lot is "carapulcra con sopa seca" a traditional Peruvian dish with meat and vegetables.  Carlos studied up to his third year in high school but he would have liked to study to be a mechanic.  Carlos is single and works as a glazier in his shop.  He is so proud of his shop that he works there 12 hours every day.  

In one day Carlos is able to assist 2 or 3 customers, though it depends on the the requests that are made.  This allows him to earn an average of approximately 100 soles (or about 37 dollars) every day and on a good day he can earn up to 200 soles (about 74 dollars).  This helps Carlos to be able to pay for some additional costs, and he thinks that his business is going well because he is punctual when he delivers the requested work that is asked of him and because of the quality and the attention he pays to customers.  

Carlos is very grateful for the help granted him by those who loan through Kiva, because with this support he will be able to purchase more merchandise for his business.  This improvement will help him to increase his inventory and continue caring for customers and as a result it will allow him in a few months to be able to enlarge his place of business and have more variety of products.  This will generate a higher return for Carlos and will help him to achieve his big dream: to buy a truck.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (pieces of glass).

loans.name: Kuña Kyrey Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo a través de una de las miembros del grupo, quien se había acercado hasta la Oficina de la Fundación Paraguaya para interiorizarse más al respecto del  Programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, la misma invito a sus amigas y compañeras del Barrio y decidieron sumarse al trabajo grupal para salir adelante y así mejorar su estilo de vida, son 23  mujeres trabajadoras y humildes que deben ganarse el sustento todos los días.
Doria es una de las integrantes, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, ella comenta que se dedica mucho para que por medio de ese esfuerzo y trabajo pueda sacar adelante a su familia. Ella se dedica a la costura y nos cuenta que con mucho sacrificio ha logrado mantener su casa y a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, botones y demás insumos, con los cuales podrá cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
This women's commission was formed through one of the members of the group, who had approached the office of Fundación Paraguaya in order to find out more about the program "Women Entrepreneurs Commission".  This member invited her friends and neighborhood acquaintances and decided to work together to get ahead and in turn to improve their quality of life.  There are 23 hard-working, humble women that need to earn enough for food every day.  

Doria is one of the members, and she is a dedicated and hard-working woman, who commented that she works really hard so that through that effort she can bring her family out of the place they are in.  She makes a living sewing and she tells us that with a lot of sacrifice she has been able to maintain her house and family.  

She is requesting the loan in order to purchase cloth, thread, buttons and other supplies, with which she will be able to carry out the requests of her customers.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, thread, buttons and other supplies.

loans.name: Ivonne Lucia

texts.es:
Ivonne Lucia es natural de Ica, Perú. Ica se encuentra ubicado en el Desierto de Sechura cerca de cuatro horas al sur de Lima, la capital del país, y es aclamado por los peruanos como "La Tierra del Sol". Es conocida en el Perú por sus frecuentes terremotos (un 8,0 en 2007 y 6.9 en 2011), su producción de uvas, espárragos y aceitunas, y tal vez sobre todo, como la fuente de la bebida tradicional del Perú nacional, el Pisco. En este clima cálido y árido se encuentra la casa y empresa del cliente. Ivonne es madre de un niño de 9 años, el cual está cursando el cuarto año de educación primaria; su platillo preferido es el “Arroz con Pollo”, este platillo se caracteriza por llevar un aderezo a base de especias como el culantro en el cual se va a cocinar el pollo dándole un sabor agradable.

Ivonne disfruta de su tiempo libre de la lectura y escuchar música, debido a que no tenía los medios económicos suficientes solo ha cursado estudios secundarios y le hubiera gustado de sobremanera ser profesora de educación inicial. Ivonne actualmente se dedica a la siembra de algodón en la parcela que ella tiene, su pareja trabaja en una mototaxi, en la cual transporta pasajeros por el barrio donde ella vive, el trabaja alrededor de cuatro horas diarias y con esta labor apoya mucho con los gastos del hogar, en un día puede ganar aproximadamente S/. 70 , en un día muy bueno puede ganar aproximadamente S/.90 y con ello obtener ingresos adicionales para los gastos adicionales del hogar, ya que actualmente no hay mucha produccion agricola y no hay muchos ingresos por esta actividad,  ella cree que su pareja tiene acogida ya que hay mucha necesidad de los pobladores por movilizarse, la persona que animo a su pareja a incursionar en esta actividad fue su papa dándole la iniciativa de que compre un mototaxi.

Ivonne agradece a los a los prestatarios Kiva ya que con el apoyo brindado podrán brindarle un mantenimiento general a la herramienta de trabajo de su pareja y con ello tendrán más clientes y mejoraran los ingresos para el hogar dando una mejor calidad de vida para su familia, y permitirle comprar otra mototaxi, para así en algunos meses poder cumplir su sueño “Tener una empresa de exportación de algodón”.
texts.en:
Ivonne Lucia is from Ica, Perú.  Ica is located in the Sechura desert approximately four hours south of Lima, the country's capitol, and it is hailed by Peruvians as "La Tierra del Sol" which means "The Land of the Sun."  It is known in Perú for its frequent earthquakes (an 8.0 in 2007 and a 6.7 in 2011), its production of grapes, asparagus, and olives, and perhaps most of all, for being the source of the traditional drink of Perú, Pisco.  In this warm and arid climate, you find Ivonne's house and business.  She is the mother of a 9 year old, who is in fourth grade in school; her favorite dish is chicken and rice, which is characterized by a dressing consisting of spices like cilantro in which the chicken is cooked, giving it a nice flavor.  

Ivonne enjoys her free time reading and listening to music.  Due to the fact that she did not have enough economic resources, she was only able to finish high school though she would have loved to be a kindergarten teacher.  Ivonne currently makes a living growing cotton on her lot of land, and her husband works on his motorcycle taxi, with which he transports passengers through the neighborhood where they live.  He works approximately four hours a day and with this work he helps a lot with the household costs.  He can earn about 70 soles (or about 26 dollars) per day, and on a good day he can earn about 90 soles (about 33 dollars), and with these extra earnings he can help with additional household costs.  Since there is not much agricultural production at present nor much earning for that work, Ivonne believes that her husband is well-received and that there is a great necessity for people to get from here to there.  The person who encouraged her husband to get into this work was his father, who motivated him to purchase a motorcycle taxi.  

Ivonne is grateful to those who loan through Kiva because with this support being given, they will be able to provide general maintenance for her husband's motorcycle and have more customers.  This will improve the earnings for the household, providing a better quality of life for her family and allowing them to purchase another motorcycle taxi which will make it possible to achieve their dream within several months: to have a cotton exportation business.

loans.use: to maintain her husband's motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Divino Jesús Group

texts.es:
El comité Divino Jesús, está constituido por 23 señoras dedicadas a todo tipo de actividades. En su mayoría  son madres de familia, quienes aportan con sus ingresos a la casa. Ellas son personas muy trabajadoras y luchadoras que se esfuerzan al máximo para poder sacar adelante a su familia.
Una de las miembros es la señora Fermina, quien se dedica a las ventas, ella es una persona que vende todo tipo de artículos, como ser frazadas, sabanas, fundas y demás tipos de artículos. Ella se define como una persona muy emprendedora y por sobre todo trabajadora, quien lucha por su familia, para poder darles lo mejor y que no pasen por necesidades.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de sabanas, frazadas, fundas y demás, con lo que podrá seguir su negocio y ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
The committee Divino Jesús is made up of 23 women engaged in all types of activities. The majority are mothers who bring their earnings home. They are very hard workers and fighters and do their best to raise their family.
One of the members is a woman named Fermina, who is in sales. She is a person who sells all types of articles like blankets, sheets, pillowcases and more types of articles. She defines herself as a very entrepreneurial person and overall hard worker who fights for her family, in order to be able to give them the best and not live without necessities.
She is requesting a loan in order to buy sheets, blankets, pillowcases and more, with which she will be able to continue with her business and helping her family.

loans.use: to buy sheets, blankets, pillowcases and more.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Rosy Margot

texts.es:
Rosy Margot es una mujer muy dedicada, tiene  2 hijos a los cuales quiere demasiado cuyas edades comprenden entre 15 y 17 años, ellos cursan actualmente el quinto año de secundaria por cual Rosy está muy orgullosa de ellos, junto a ella esta su esposo, el cual se dedica a la minería y quien la apoya mucho y es su mano derecha en todo, Rosy vive en Camaná, un oasis en el otro modo de largo y seco desierto de Sechura que domina la costa en la parte sudoeste del país. Camaná ha sido históricamente un importante destino turístico en el Perú, sin embargo, los frecuentes y fuertes terremotos y tsunamis en la última década (un 8,4 en 2001 y 8,0 en 2007) diezmó la ciudad, destruyendo la industria del turismo en Camaná, y eliminando muchos de sus puestos de trabajo. Pero el resultado de un desempleo es que crea un ambiente preparado para las microfinanzas; y lo más impactante de  Camaná son sus playas las cuales son muy hermosas, como bien se sabe el Perú se caracteriza por tener las comidas más deliciosas del mundo y uno de los platos que a Rosy  le gusta mucho es el  “Pescado Frito”. Rosy  solo estudio hasta el cuarto año de secundaria, debido a que sus padres no contaban con los medio económicos adecuados, pero a ella le hubiera gustado estudiar Cosmetología.

Rosy se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas diariamente, atendiendo un promedio de 40 clientes aproximadamente, en un día puede ganar hasta S/. 50 pero en un día muy bueno puede ganar hasta S/. 60, con lo cual le ayuda con los gastos adicionales del hogar, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio gracias a su trato amable hacia sus clientes y porque ofrece productos de buena calidad.

Actualmente esta mas que agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le han brindado ella va poder comprar más productos para ofrecer en su negocio y ya que es temporada navideña comprar productos navideños para ofrecer a sus clientes y tener mucho más variedad, ello mejorara su negocio dándole más ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida, también con estos ingresos podrá ahorrar más dinero para poder lograr su más grande sueño: “Mejorar su vivienda”
texts.en:
Rosy Margot is a very dedicated woman.  She has two children between the ages of 15 and 17 whom she loves much too much.  They are now in the fifth year of secondary school, and Rosy is very proud of them.  Her husband, a miner, lives with her.  He supports her a lot, and he is her right hand in everything.

Rosy lives in Camaná, an oasis on the other side of the long and dry Sechura desert, which dominates the coast in the southeastern part of Peru. Camaná has historically been an important tourist destination in Peru. Nevertheless, the frequent and strong earthquakes and tsunamis in the past decade (an 8.4 in 2001 and an 8.0 in 2007) decimated the city, destroying the tourist industry in Camaná and costing many of the residents their jobs.

The result of unemployment is that it creates an atmosphere that is ready for microfinance.  Its beaches, which are beautiful, are Camaná’s most striking feature.  As it is well-known, Perú is known for having the most delicious food in the world.  One of the dishes that Rosy likes a lot is “Pescado Frito” (fried fish).

Rosy only went to school until the fourth year of secondary school because her parents did not have adequate finances.  However, she would have liked to study cosmetology.

Rosy sells groceries.  She devotes about ten hours a day to her business, waiting on an average of approximately 40 people.  In one day she is able to earn up to 50 soles.  However on a very good day she is able to earn 60 soles.  This helps her with the additional household expenses.  She believes that her business is going well for her thanks to her friendly treatment of the customers and because she offers good quality products.

She is currently more than pleased with the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the support they have given her she will be able to buy more products to offer in her business.  Because it is the Christmas season she will buy Christmas products to offer her customers.  She will have a much greater variety, and this will improve her business.  That will give her more income and improve her quality of life.  Also, with these earnings she will be able to save more money in order to fulfill her biggest dream:  Improving her house.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (groceries and Christmas products).

loans.name: Las Marias Group

texts.es:
El comité Las Marias nace gracias a la ayuda de otro comité que trabajaba en la zona. Ellas son mujeres con muchas ganas de salir adelante y ayudar a auss familias. Este comité es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo,  son 12  integrantes, quienes se fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas en lo personal como laboral.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Norma, ella nos cuenta que por medio de la costura que ella hace, ha podido ayudar en la casa y cubrir los gastos del día a día. Cuenta que tiene muy buena clientela ya que ella siempre hace muy buenos trabajos. Ella desea poder seguir con su negocio y es por ello que solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, botones, y demás insumos necesarios para su negocio.
Ella al igual que sus amigas están muy agradecidas por la oportunidad que están recibiendo de kiva y fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
The Las Marias committee was born thanks to the help of another committee working in the area. They are women who are eager to get ahead and to help their families. This committee is from the City of San Lorenzo. There are 12 members, and they have fixed as their principal objective the growth of each one of them, both personally and in their work. 
One of the members is Norma. She tells us that by means of the sewing that she does, she has been able to help at home and cover the day-to-day expenses. She says that she has a good customer base since she always makes good products. She desires to continue in her business, which is why she is requesting the loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons and other inputs necessary for her business.
She, like her friends, is very grateful for the opportunity that they are receiving from Kiva and the Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons and other inputs.

loans.name: Amanecer Group

texts.es:
Este grupo es de la ciudad de Encarnación, surgió por contactos de una de las integrantes en la zona con la asesora de la fundación, quien luego de saber como trabajaba el programa decidió animar a sus amigas y vecinas. actualmente el grupo se encuentra en el ciclo numero 18, opera con la Fundación desde el año 2006.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Alicia, quien es casada, tiene 2 hijos. Ella nos cuenta que tiene una pequeña despensa en su casa, y su marido se dedica a la venta de gas y también realizan alquileres para eventos infantiles. Ambos se ayudan para poder sacar adelante a la familia. Alicia comenta que le va muy bien en las ventas y es por ello que solicita el crédito, para poder abastecer su negocio y de esa forma darle más variedad a la despensa, para poder seguir con las ganancias.
Ella desea comprar comestibles, bebidas, lácteos, panificados y demás. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por esta oportunidad de progreso que les da.
texts.en:
This group is from the city of Encarnación and came about because of contacts one of the members in the area had with the foundation's loan officer who, after learning how the program worked, decided to encourage her friends and neighbors. Currently the group is in its 18th loan cycle and has been working with the Foundation since the year 2006. 

One of the group's members is Ms. Alicia who is married with two children. She tells us she has a small grocery store in her home, and her husband earns a living selling natural gas, and they also provide rental services for children's events. They both help each other get the family ahead. Alicia comments that she is doing very well with her sales and so she is requesting the loan, so she may stock her business, giving it more variety in order to continue bringing in income. 

She wishes to purchase grocery items, drinks, dairy products, bakery items and other things. She appreciates the foundation and Kiva for this opportunity for progress they are being given.

loans.use: to purchase groceries, drinks, dairy products, bakery products and other items.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
14 mujeres de la ciudad de Encarnación se han unido para luchar juntas por el ideal de cada una de ellas, vieron una gran oportunidad en el programa de la fundación paraguaya y desean poder salir adelante gracias a este. Actualmente se encuentran en el ciclo numero 10, quienes trabajan con la fundación desde el 2009.
La señora Reina es una mujer muy emprendedora y muestra de ello es que tiene una lavandería y un copetín (establecimiento de comida rápida y de bebidas) bien surtido. Gracias a su esfuerzo y trabajo incansables, puede darle a su familia lo mínimo para que tengan una vida digna y decorosa, sin privaciones como las que ella tuvo que atravesar.
Reina pide ala ayuda de la fundación y de kiva, para la compra de comestibles, bebidas con lo cual podrá abastecer su local y seguir ofreciendo buenos productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Fourteen women from the city of Encarnación have united in order to work hard together.  The members saw a great opportunity in the Fundación Paraguaya’s program.  Each one of them wishes to be able to get ahead, thanks to this program.  They are currently in their tenth cycle, and they have worked with the Fundación since 2009.

Reina is a very enterprising woman.  She demonstrates this as she has a laundry business and a well-stocked “copetín” (a fast food and drink establishment).  Thanks to her effort and her untiring work, she is able to give her family the minimum in order to have a dignified and decent life without the deprivations that she had to go through.  

Reina is asking for help from the Fundación and Kiva.  She will buy food and drinks so that she will be able to stock her place and continue offering her customers good products.

loans.use: to buy food and drinks for her fast food business.

loans.name: Abdujamil

texts.ru: Абдучамилe 26 лет, женат, имеет двоих детей. Он занимается продажей продуктов питания на рынке города. Имеет большой ассортимент продуктов для первой необходимости населения. Кредитуется Абдучамил с 2010 года и с тех пор сумел развернуть свой товарооборот вдвое. Сейчас в канун Нового года у него очень хорошая торговля и ему хотелось бы расширить ассортимент. На полученный кредит он хочет закупить несколько разновидностей шоколадных конфет Российского производства. Абдучамил рад сотрудничать с организацией, благодарен за своевременное финансирование и понимание.
texts.en: Abdujamil is 26 years old, married and has two children.  He is involved in selling food products at a city market.  He has a wide selection of products to meet people's immediate needs.  Abdujamil has been obtaining financing since 2010 and, since then, was able to double his goods turnover.  Currently, prior to the New Year's, his sales are going well, and he wants to expand his selection.  He wants to use this loan to purchase several varieties of Russian-made chocolates.  Abdujamil is happy to be partnering with our organization and is grateful for the timely financing and understanding.

loans.use: to purchase several varieties of chocolate

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité se Denomina “Mujeres Unidas” están  en el Primer ciclo, con 14 integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca en el barrio por ser muy activas y responsables. Ellas está empezando a trabajar con la fundación y ven un gran futuro en el programa, ya que ellas con su esfuerzo y con la ayuda que obtienen dicen que podrá salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias.
Ananias es la presidenta del grupo, ella comenta que tiene un despensa, la cual con mucho sacrificio ha podido levantar. Dice que empezó con una despensa chiquita, pero que con el tiempo pudo crecer y aumentar u poco su negocio, hoy en día, la mayoría de sus vecinos ya la conocen y ya tiene muy buena clientela e ingresos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carne, verduras, hortalizas, pan, leche y demás artículos de primera necesidad, los cuales tienen mucha venta. Agradece una vez más por esta oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
The committee is called "Mujeres Unidas" [United Women] and is in its first loan cycle, with 14 members. The group stands out in its neighborhood for being very active and responsible. They are beginning to work with the foundation and see a great future in the program since with their effort and the help they receive they say they can get ahead and help their families. 

Ananias is the president of the group. She comments that she has a grocery store that she has been able to establish with much sacrifice. She says she started with a tiny grocery store, but with time was able to grow and expand her business a little. Today the majority of her neighbors know her already and she already has a very good customer base and income. 

She is seeking the loan for the purchase of meat, greens, garden vegetables, bread, milk and other staples, which sell well. She gives thanks once again for this opportunity she is being given.

loans.use: to purchase meat, greens, vegetables, bread, milk and other items.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en: Marissa is a 36-year-old married woman with four children. The oldest child is 11 years old. Her husband works as a driver. Marissa has been running a sari-sari store for 6 years. She sells items like soy sauce, vinegar, cooking oil and canned goods. Marissa is able to help provide for her family's daily needs through her business. Marissa is requesting a loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to to buy more items to sell such as soft drinks and rice. Marissa hopes for her business to grow. She also hopes to be able to sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as soft drinks and rice

loans.name: Aubrey Marie

texts.en:
Aubrey Marie is a 23-year-old married woman with two children, ages 5 and 2. Her husband works as a farmer. Aubrey Marie owns a dry goods store in Trinidad, Bohol. She has had this business for a year now. Aubrey Marie sells items like toys, cell phone accessories, and ladies accessories. She earns about 9,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month with this business.

Aubrey Marie has requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as toys, beauty products and school supplies. In the future, Aubrey Marie says she hopes to have "a great and wonderful life".

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as toys, beauty products and school supplies

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en: Cecelia is a 48-year-old married woman with 10 children. Her children are between the ages of 5 and 30 years old. Cecelia’s husband works as a farmer. Cecelia is also a farmer. She and her husband till their land in Trinidad, Bohol together. Cecelia’s husband mainly manages their rice farm. Cecelia, on the other hand, does her best to help maintain their farm and run their sari-sari store business. Cecelia works hard to keep her family healthy and her children in school. Cecelia has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and school supplies. Cecelia hopes to have a successful business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and school supplies

loans.name: Jason

texts.en:
Jason is a 28 year-old married man with a three year-old child. He lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol with his family.

Jason buys and sells bananas and has been in this business for 5 years.  He earns 3000 PHP a month.  

He requested this loan to buy more products to sell such as bananas and potatoes. 

Jason works hard to sustain his family.  He hopes to earn more and save for his child’s education.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell such as bananas and potatoes.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a 50 year-old married woman with 8 children. Her husband is a farmer.

Rebecca runs a sari-sari (convenience) store business in Trinidad, Bohol, where she also lives with her family.   She sells items like canned goods, eggs, soft drinks, soap and shampoo.  Rebecca also helps her husband manage their rice farm.

Rebecca has requested this loan to buy fertilizers and more items to sell such as canned goods, sugar and eggs.  Rebecca plans to use her profit to pay for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and more items to sell such as canned goods, sugar and eggs.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is a 56 year-old married woman with 8 children. Her husband works as a farmer.

Teodora runs a dry goods store in Trinidad, Bohol. She sells items like ladies accessories, toys, cellphone accessories and flashlights. Teodora is able to support her family financially with her business.

Teodora has requested this loan to buy more items to sell such as sandals, toys and accessories.  Teodora hopes her business and family’s living conditions will improve.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as sandals, toys and accessories.

loans.name: Mujeres Al Poder Group

texts.es:
El comité se Denomina “Mujeres al Poder” están en el Quinto Ciclo con 17  integrantes, es un grupo de señoras muy responsables y trabajadoras, que diariamente se esfuerzan para poder cambiar la vida de sus familias. Ellas se unieron con el propósito de salir adelante y de crecer, no solo en lo económico, sino también en lo personal.
Una mujer muy trabajadora es Sara, quien se dedica a lavar ropas, comenta que su trabajo es muy sacrificado, ya que día a día lava muchísimas ropas y eso es muy agotador, pero nos dice que no se cansa, ya que por medio de su trabajo ella ha podido ayudar a su familia y sacarlos adelante. Ella dice que su trabajo es muy dignificador y por sobre todo honesto.
Ella pide la ayuda de la fundación y de kiva, para poder comprar suavizantes para ropas, jabones en polvo, desinfectantes y demás artículos que utiliza para el lavado de las ropas.
texts.en:
The committee is called "Mujeres al Poder" [Women To Power] and is in its fifth loan cycle with 17 members. It is a group of very responsible and hardworking women who make the effort every day in order to change their families' lives. They joined together with the goal of getting ahead and of growing, not only financially but as people. 

One very hardworking woman is Sara who devotes herself to washing clothes. She comments that her work is very demanding since she washes a large amount of clothing every day and it is quite exhausting. Nevertheless she tells us she does not get tired because by her work she has been able to help her family and get them ahead. She says that her work is quite dignifying and above all, honest. 

She asks for help from the foundation and from Kiva so that she may buy fabric softeners, powdered soaps, disinfectant and other items she uses in the washing of the clothes.

loans.use: to purchase fabric softeners, powdered soaps, disinfectant and other items.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is a 28-year-old motorcycle transport business owner from Trinidad, Bohol.  

He is single and hopes to have his own family soon.

Felix is able to support his family through his business and works hard to save for his future family.  Felix has requested this loan to buy motorcycle spare parts and gasoline.  Felix hopes this loan will improve his income.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts and gasoline.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is married and has 6 children.  She is 49-year-old and lives in the Philippines. 

Merlyn is a farmer.  She plants, harvests and sells banana to earn a living.  She has been doing this for 4 years and every month earns PHP 3,000. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase fertilizer such as manure. 

In 2007, Merlyn joined GDMPC to access financial services to improve her business and living situation.  In the future, Merlyn hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is from Calabayan, Ozamis City.  She is a 28 years old widow and has four children. 

To make a living, Jonalyn runs a general store, selling a variety of food and home use products in her local community.  Jonalyn has been in business for 3 years and earns approximately 3,600 PHP a month.

Jonalyn is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP, to purchase new items to expand product offering.  

In 2007, Jonalyn joined GDMPC to access financial services to improve her business and living situation.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve fund for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Lodgenia

texts.en:
Lodgenia is 53 years old and widowed with four adult children.  She is from Malibangcao, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 

To make a living, Lodgenia sells baked goods in the local community.  Lodgenia has been engaged in her business for 11 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. 

Lodgenia joined GDMPC in 2007 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. 

Lodgenia is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase raw materials used in business.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials used in business.

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en:
Marlon is from Poblacion 3, Clarin, Misamis Occidental.  He is 36 years old, married and has three school-aged children. 

To make a living, Marlon provides transportation services to local community members.  Marlon has been engaged in his business for 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Marlon joined GDMPC to access financial services to improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. 

Marlon is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP, to repair his motorcycle so be can improve is income.  He plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Patrona

texts.en:
Patrona is from Capucao, Ozamiz City. She is 41 years old and married with four grown-up children. Patrona owns and operates a specialized retail business to earn a living. She has been engaged in her business for 9 years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. 

In 2009, Patrona joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ha

texts.en: Mrs. Ha is student Tuan’s mother. Tuan is attending school for vocational training. His program lasts three years. After graduation, he will become a skilled mechanician. He hopes to find a suitable job with stable income in a factory near his house. Currently, he wants to use this loan of 10,206,000 Viet nam dong to pay for tuition fees and transportation.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and transportation.

loans.name: Arman

texts.en:
Armando is a 34 year-old married man with 3 children. His oldest child is 14 years old.

Armando has had a tricycle taxi business for 10 years. He earns about 5000 PHP per month with this business. Armando also tills land where he grows rice crops. Armando's harvest is for family consumption.

Armando has requested this loan to purchase spare parts and fertilizer. Armando hopes for his income to improve. He also hopes to own a bigger farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and fertilizer.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is a 28 year old married woman with three young children. The oldest child is 7 years old. Jessica's husband works as a fisherman.

Jessica has had a sari-sari store business for 6 years. She sells items like canned goods, rice, noodles, coffee and sugar. Jessica earns about 5000 PHP per month with her store. Jessica also helps her husband sell fresh fish and crabs int the market. Jessica works hard to support her family.

Jessica has requested this loan to buy fishing nets and more items to sell such as canned goods and rice. Jessica hopes for her businesses to grow.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and more items to sell such as canned goods and rice.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer, 37, is a married woman with three children ages 9, 8 and 6.  Her husband owns and manages a vulcanizing shop.

Jennifer owns a sari-sari (convenience) store and has been in business for three years.  She sells items like canned goods, coffee, sugar and school supplies.  Jennifer works hard to improve her business so she can continue to support her family.

Jennifer has requested this loan to buy more items to sell, such as rice and canned goods. Jennifer hopes her business will grow.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, such as rice and canned goods.

loans.name: Ma. Jonep

texts.en:
Ma. Jonep is a 35-year-old married woman with two children ages 13 and 8.  She is a rice farmer and works in Talibon, Bohol.  Ma. Jonep also sells cosmetics to the people in her community.

Ma. Jonep has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers and cosmetics to sell.  She hopes to have a stable income that will help her sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Robina's Group

texts.en:
Robina has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband who has a business selling fruit and fresh fruit juices. He operates his juice corner in the market where he serves his customers with fresh fruits and fresh juices. With the loan investment, he will buy fresh seasonal fruits and another juicer machine that will allow him to offer juices to many customers at one time. 

She herself also works and operates an embroidery and sewing business. She is very passionate about her work and offers good quality work to her clients at reasonable rates. She charges PKRs 150 for each dress. The income she earns helps her pay utility bills and manage other household expenses.
 
She has given birth to two sons and two daughters. Due to financial constraints, Robina couldn’t provide education facilities to them. 

Her husband has been operating his business for the past many years. Robina is hopeful that an investment will be a productive one for him and that it will increase his profits. 

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Robina.

loans.use: To buy fruits and another juicer machine

loans.name: Bibisoro

texts.ru: Бибисоро 38 – летная женщина, проживающая в Гиссарском районе. Она замужем. У нее пятеро детей. Она занимается торговлей. Бибисоро открыла продуктовый магазин, где работает продавцом. Она берет кредит для покупки колбасных изделий и приобретения холодильника.
texts.en: Bibisoro is a 38 year old resident of the Gissar region. She is marrieds and has five children. Bibisoro works in retail, she opened her own grocery store where she works as a cashier. She requires this loan to purchase a deli fridge as well as meats and sausages fot sale.

loans.use: to purchase a fridge as well as sausages and deli meats

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru: Фотима проживает в Гиссарском районе. Она замужем. Ей 43 года. У нее пятеро детей. Ее муж водитель. Сама она разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности она занимается 10 лет. Кредит берет для расширения своей деятельности.
texts.en: Fotima lives in the Gissar region. She is married. She is 43 years old and has five children. Her husband is a driver. She breeds cattle for further resale. She has been in this business for ten years. Fotima is taking out the loan to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy large horned cattle and repair the cowshed.

loans.name: Bayarsaikhan

texts.en:
Mr. Bayarsaikhan, 53, sells spare parts for Russian cars in a market. He has been running his business since 1998 and has permanent customers. 

He lives with his wife, and all of their children have moved out their home. His wife is unemployed and has been sick for many years. 

Bayarsaikhan wants to increase his sales volume for business expansion. He decided to purchase a large amount of spare parts from his supplier. It is beneficial for his business for improving it further. The loan he is taking will be dedicated to purchasing inventory for increasing working capital.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for increasing working capital.

loans.name: Terbish

texts.en: At this time, Terbish is requesting a loan to purchase necessary building materials for making renovations to his house and fence.

loans.use: To purchase necessary building materials for making renovations to his house and fence.

loans.name: Byambasuren

texts.en:
Mr. Byambasuren is a 46-year-old who lives with his wife and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He was employed as a welder before, but the salary wasn’t enough to meet his family's necessities, so he started driving a taxi four years ago. Beyond the taxi business, he services cars for more earnings. 

Byambasuren’s wife is pregnant and is going to give birth soon. He is very worried about his old house’s condition as the new baby is coming. The loan he is requesting will be used to repair the roof and other parts of his house.

loans.use: To repair the roof and other parts of his house.

loans.name: Tsoggerel

texts.en:
Mr. Tsoggerel is 41 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been running a taxi business since 2010. Tsoggerel tries to work hard and he does not take any days of the week off.
 
He has requested a loan to make adjustments and renovations to his house's hallway because he wants to change it to a dining room that is furnished with gas heating and a gas furnace. It is absolutely beneficial and important to this family's finances, and likewise their living conditions, and will be harmless to the environment. Also, he is planning to insulate the walls. Therefore, he needs additional funding to purchase some building materials including bricks, cement, sand, iron pipe, etc., for making a renovation to his house's hallway.

loans.use: to purchase some building materials including bricks, cement, sand, iron pipe, etc., for making a renovation to his house's hallway.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru: Дилором жительница города Турсунзаде. Ей 21 год. Она не замужем. У нее среднее образование. На сегодняшний день она занимается торговлей приправы. Кредит берет для покупки семян и приправ.
texts.en: Dilorom is a resident of the town of Tursun-zoda. She is 21 years old and not married. She has secondary education. At this time she sells spices. Dilorom is taking out the loan to buy seeds and spices.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and spices.

loans.name: Enkhtuya

texts.en:
Mrs. Enkhtuya, 48, is a clothing seller and lives with her husband and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband, Otgonbayar, was pensioned two years ago. 

Enkhtuya sells clothes at the bazaar and brings in the clothing from abroad. Since her daughter became a student of college, she has started to face the difficulties of paying her daughter’s school fees and other expenses.

Therefore, she is requesting a loan to purchase a large numbers of casual clothes to increase her working capital and selling more clothes to her customers. It is beneficial to increase her earnings in the further.

loans.use: To to purchase a large numbers of casual clothes and raise her income by increasing her working capital and selling more clothes to her customers.

loans.name: Bashiran's Group

texts.en:
Bashiran is a 49-year-old lady who is a private job holder. She does this work to financially contribute to the family. She earns on a monthly basis and she utilizes her earnings to manage the household expenses. 

Bashiran’s husband has been a rickshaw driver for the last 15 years. He owns a rickshaw, which he drives for almost 9 – 10 hours a day. He provides transport facilities to the passengers and drops them off at their designated places. He charges them area wise. In this way, he puts three meals on the table for the family. 

Bashiran has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will repair his rickshaw’s engine because it is creating problem for him while he is driving. She is hopeful that the loan investment will bring positive financial changes to her husband’s business and help him to continue his business.

loans.use: To repair a rickshaw engine

loans.name: Mamurjon

texts.ru: Мамуржон занимается торговлей семян и сухофруктов. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 21 год. Ему 52 года. Он женат. У него двое детей. Мамуржон берет кредит для закупа приправы и семян овощей.
texts.en: Mamujon sells seeds and dry fruits. He has been in this business for twenty one years. He is 52 years old, he is married and has two children. Mamurjon is taking out the loan to buy spices and vegetable seeds.

loans.use: to purchase spices and vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is a married woman who has four children. Marieta is 45 years old and resides at Mobod, Oroquieta City, Philippines. 

Marieta owns and operates a charcoal business to earn a living and she's been in this business for nine years. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase wood & wood-related products needed in charcoal making.

In 2010, Marieta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities.

loans.use: to purchase wood & wood-related products needed in charcoal making

loans.name: Amna's Group

texts.en:
Amna is 36 years old. She is married and has three daughters and a son. Her two elder daughters do decorative embroidery and the other two children are getting their education.
 
Her husband is a master tailor and Amna is an embroidery expert. She does embroidery on clothes for her neighboring clients and earns reasonably good profits. Now her two daughters also work with her and support her in completing the orders on time. 

Amna has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for further expansion of her husband’s tailoring business. With the loan investment, he will buy a new sewing machine and will also hire a worker for his assistance. This will allow him to complete the orders on time and increase his profits. He has been operating his business for the past many years and Amna is confident about his success after investing the loan.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine and hire an assistant

loans.name: Malika

texts.ru: Малика занимается торговлей продуктов питания оптом. Ей 29 лет. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Она берет кредит для увеличения ассортимента товара.
texts.en: Malika sells food products in bulk.  She is 29 years old and married.  She hast two children.  She is requesting a loan in order to increase her range of merchandise.

loans.use: To increase her range of merchandise.

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz has requested a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the improvement of her son’s LPG gas cylinders sales business. He has a good clientele base of regular customers. His father also spends some time with him during the day and guides him off and on.
 
With the loan investment, he will purchase a larger number of gas cylinders, which will allow him to fulfill the client orders on time and increase his profits.
 
Shahnaz is a seamstress as well as embroidery expert. She works for her neighborhood clients to financially support her husband. He is a farmer and grows different crops. Shahnaz has two other daughters and sons. All of them work except the youngest one who is studying in class 7th. She is confident that her son’s business will be improved after an investment and she will be able to save some profits for her eldest daughter’s marriage.

loans.use: To buy LPG gas cylinders to sell

loans.name: Bolot

texts.ru:
Болоту 48 лет, женат и воспитывает четверых детей.
Болот родился в простой и многодетной семье фермера, и с детства помогал отцу по хозяйству. Мать работала в соседнем селе на фабрике по производству ниток и тканей. После окончания школы Болот поступил на учебу в автошколу, где проучился 6 месяцев. Закончив учебу, устроился в родном колхозе на работу в качестве водителя грузовых автомашин. В 1979 году в возрасте 17 лет Болот женился, и первое время Болот с женой жили с родителями. В 1982 году, отслужив в армии два года, Болот вернулся в родное село, к своей семье, и снова стал работать в местном колхозе. В этом же году у Болота родился первый сын, а в 1984 году – второй. В этом же году супруга Болота устроилась на работу в местный магазин, и  на заработанные деньги Болот с женой покупали скот. Через некоторое время колхоз выделил Болоту участок земли в родном селе и распродав часть скота, Болот построил на участке небольшой дом с надворными постройками, куда он со своей семьей переезжает от родителей. Болот по-прежнему продолжал работать в колхозе, супруга устроилась в местную сельскую управу в качестве кассира. 
Семья Болота росла, и росли потребности. Зарплаты шофера не хватало, и Болот устроился на работу на спиртовой завод в качестве плотника. Проработав там 5 лет, попал под сокращение. В 2008 году выходит замуж старшая дочка Болота и для того, чтобы выдать замуж дочь и собрать ей приданное, Болоту пришлось распродать часть скота.
В данное время, благодаря  упорству и трудолюбию, у Болота в хозяйстве имеется 3 дойных коровы и 18 овец. В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Болот обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. В ближайших планах Болота - строительство большого сарая и увеличение поголовья домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Bolotu is 48 years old, married, and is raising four children. Bolot grew up in an ordinary and large farm family, and has helped his father keep up the farm since he was a child. His mother worked at a yarn and fabric factory in a nearby village. After graduating from school, Bolot went to driving school, where he studied for six months. After finishing his studies, he got a job at a local collective farm as a truck driver. In 1979, Bolot got married at the age of 17. At first Bolot and his wife lived with his parents. In 1982, after serving in the army for two years, Bolot returned to his hometown and to his family, and once again began to work at the local collective farm. That same year Bolot's first son was born, and a second son was born in 1984. That same year Bolot's wife got a job at a local store, and they used the money to buy livestock. Shortly thereafter, the collective farm allocated Bolot a parcel of land in his hometown, and, after having sold some of their livestock, Bolot built a small house with some outbuildings. Then Bolot and his family moved there from his parents' place. Bolot continued to work at the collective farm, and his wife got a job as a cashier at a local agricultural office.

Bolot's family grew, and so did their needs. A driver's salary was not enough, and Bolot got a job as a carpenter at a alcohol manufacturing plant. After working there for five years, he got laid off. In 2008, Bolot's oldest daughter was to be married, and Bolot had to sell some of his livestock to marry off his daughter and put together a dowry for her.

Right now, thanks to his persistence and industriousness, Bolot has 3 milking cows and 18 sheep on his farm. In order to increase his livestock headcount, Bolot has gone to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 70,000 som (KGS) to purchase more livestock. Bolot's short-term plans include building a large barn and increasing his livestock headcount.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Tursunoy

texts.ru: Турсуной 32 года. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Она уже три года как занимается торговлей. Целью получения кредита является покупка конфет и шоколада.
texts.en: Tursunoy is 32 years old, and married. She has three children. She has been involved in the retail business for three years. She is requesting a loan to purchase sweets and chocolate.

loans.use: to purchase sweets and chocolate

loans.name: Davlatyor

texts.ru: Давлатбек женат и ответственный отец семерых детей. Более 21 года он занимается выращиванием сельхозпродуктов. После сборки урожая он ездит на рынок и оптом продает  розничным торговцам. В бизнесе помогает ему его жена и брат. Они вместе сеют семена, а также собирают урожай. Давлатбек хотел бы получить займ в размере 2000$ США для покупки ГСМ, минеральных удобрений, семян и прополку. Он надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарен вам за вашу доброту и помощь.
texts.en: Davlatyor is married and is a responsible father of seven children.  He has been involved in growing agricultural crops for over 21 years.  After gathering the harvest, he goes to a market and sells his harvest to retailers.  His wife and brother help him with this business.  Together, they sow seeds and also gather the harvest.  Davlatyor wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $2000 for the purchase of fuel, mineral fertilizers, seeds and weeds treatment.  He relies on your help and thanks you in advance for your kindness and help.

loans.use: to buy fuel, fertilizers, seeds and weeds treatment

loans.name: Buribek

texts.ru: Последние годы Бурибек занимается выращиванием и продажей сельхозпродуктов. Он трудолюбивый и честный человек, женат и ответственный отец шестерых детей. Его семья очень большая и он старается содержать их в хороших условиях жизни. Бурибек выращивает овощи, такие, как лук, морковь и картошку. С детства он привык работать на земле, так как он вырос в деревне. Бурибек хотел бы получить займ в размере 3000 Сомони для покупки ГСМ, минеральных удобрений, семян и прополку. Он надеется на вашу помощь и милосердие.
texts.en: Buribek has been growing and selling produce for the last several years. He is an industrious and honest person. He is married, and a responsible father of six children. His family is vary large, and he tries to provide a good quality of life for them. Buribek grows vegetables, such as onions, carrots, and potatoes. Since childhood he has been accustomed to working on the land, as he grew up in the countryside. Buribek would like to recieve a loan of 3,000 Somoni to buy gas and oil, fertilzers, seeds, and weeding. He looks forward to your help and kindness.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizer, seeds, fuel and weeding

loans.name: Azra's Group

texts.en:
Azra has requested a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the expansion of her Pranda and elastic sales business. Pranda is a traditional product used to tie women's hair firmly. It is a very popular product and has high demand in the country. She sells her products to the market and to her community clients at a profit. She does this work to financially contribute to the family.
 
With the loan investment, Azra will buy thread and beads in larger quantity for making Prandas in larger quantity and she will buy elastics to sell. She is very experienced in her business and has a good number of business contacts. 

Her husband is an expert in furniture manufacturing and sells his furniture for a good price. Azra has given birth to four sons and a daughter. Except for her youngest son who is two years old, all the others are enrolled in local school and getting their education. 

Azra is confident about her business improvement after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy thread, beads and elastics

loans.name: Muhamadamon

texts.ru: Мухамадамон женат и любящий отец двоих детей. Он занимается выращиванием и продажей сельхозпродуктов. Мухаммадамон целеустремленный и трудолюбивый человек. Более 6 лет он занимается этим бизнесом и любит свое дело. В бизнесе помогает ему супруга, и они вместе дружно работают. Мухаммадамон хотел бы получить займ в размере 5000 Сомони для покупки ГСМ, минеральных удобрений для переработки земли, а также семян для предстоящего посева. Он надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарен вам за вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Muhamadamon is married and is a loving father of two children.  He is involved in growing and selling agricultural crops.  Muhamadamon is a goal-oriented and hardworking person.  He has been involved in this business for over six years and loves his work.  His wife helps him with the business, and they work happily together.  Muhamadamon wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 5000 Somoni to purchase fuel, mineral fertilizers to treat the land, and also seeds for the upcoming sowing.  He relies on your help and thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to buy fuel, mineral fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Salima

texts.ru: Салима замужем и любящая мать шестерых детей. Её семья большая и она решила помогать мужу в содержания семьи. Более 17 лет она занимается купле- продажей женских тканей. Салима имеет широкий ассортимент товаров и имеет много постоянных клиентов. Салима хотела бы получить займ в размере 1500$ США для покупки новых товаров с целью пополнения оборотного капитала и улучшения ассортимента тканей. Она надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Salima is married and is a loving mother of six children.  Her family is large, and she decided to help her husband to support the family.  She has been involved in buying and selling women's fabrics for over 17 years.  Salima has a wide selection of merchandise and has many regular customers.  She wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $1500 for the purchase of new merchandise in order to increase her working capital and improve the selection of fabrics.  Salima relies on your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy fabrics in order to expand merchandise selection

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.en:
This is Teodoro, 39, a resident of Silang, Cavite Philippines. He is married to Flordeliza, a housewife, and a father to their child. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Teodoro oversees operations of their Jeepney transportation business. They have one unit of Jeep that carries up to 16 passengers to their destination within the community. He earns from the boundary (daily quota) their driver remits everyday. Their regular passengers and customers are from the local community. He earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in boundary every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. He will be using the loan for the maintenance of his Jeepney unit. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.  

He dreams of giving his family a good future. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their jeepney unit

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen is a 40-year-old married woman who lives with her family, a husband and five children. She has enrolled all of her children into school. To meet their education expenses and to support her husband financially, she operates a clothes sales business. She has had several years of experience in her business. Her clientele base is her community clients and shop owners. She buys clothes from other different cities for quality and variety: that’s why her customers approach her to buy clothes. She makes a good income every month. 

Parveen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her clothes sales business. She will invest the loan in buying different varieties of clothes  in bulk quantities for reselling. She is confident that she will make good sales from her business and further improve it.
Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called an Asasah Passbook) is Parveen.

loans.use: To buy clothes for re-selling

loans.name: Khaticha

texts.ru: Хатича замужем и любящая мать пятерых детей. Более 17 лет она занимается купле- продажей детской одежды. Она трудолюбивая женщина и усердно работает ради улучшения благосостояния семьи. Она хочет устроить своих детей в хорошие университеты, чтобы видить их  образованными и воспитанными людьми. С этой целью Хатича расширяет свой бизнес, чтобы получить максимум дохода. Она запрашивает займ в размере 2000 Сомони для покупки новых товаров для пополнения оборотного капитала. Она надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарна вам за вашу щедрость и милосердие.
texts.en: Khaticha is married and is a loving mother of five children.  She has been involved in buying and selling children's clothing for over 17 years.  She is a hardworking woman, who works diligently to improve her family's welfare.  She wants to place her children into good universities, in order to see them as educated and well-mannered people.  With this goal in mind, Khaticha expands her business in order to maximize her income.  She is requesting a loan in the sum of 2,000 Somoni to purchase new merchandise in order to increase her working capital.  She relies on your help and thanks you in advance for your generosity and mercy.

loans.use: to purchase new merchandise

loans.name: Etienne

texts.en:
Etienne is 32 years old and is married with three children aged between 3 and 9 years old. He takes care of four dependents. He has two years' experience selling various goods such as: lotions, sugar, soap, toothpaste, cooking oil, etc. The hours of his business are from 6.30am to 5pm per day each week and he currently employs one person to help him. 

Etienne has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase various goods such as: lotions, sugar, soap, toothpaste, cooking oil, etc. to sell. With any profits from the loan, Etienne would like to satisfy his family's basic needs and start saving for his future and he will be able to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To purchase goods such as: lotions, sugar, soap, toothpaste, etc. to sell

loans.name: Khorolsuren

texts.en:
Mrs. Khorolsuren, 44, works in the television company as a janitress. She has been doing her job for many years and lives with her children and her husband in a ger, the nomadic Mongolian traditional tent. A ger is a portable, bent wood-framed dwelling structure traditionally used by Mongolian nomads in the steppes of Central Asia. The structure comprises a crown or compression wheel usually steam bent, supported by roof ribs, which are bent down at the end where they meet the lattice wall. The structure is usually covered by layers of fabric and sheep-wool felt for insulation and weatherproofing.

Her ger cover has been become very old and bad for covering. During winter, her ger becomes very cold. It is harmful for the health of her family members. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to cover the cost of a new ger-cover from the market.

loans.use: To cover the cost of a new ger cover

loans.name: Claude

texts.en:
Claude is 20 years old and is single. He has four years' experience selling various goods like: lotions, sugar, soap, toothpaste, etc.  The hours of his business are from 7am to 8pm per day each week and he currently employs one person to help him. 

Claude has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase various goods such as: lotions, sugar, soap, toothpaste, etc. to sell. With any profits from the loan, Claude would like to satisfy his family's basic needs and to start saving for his future. Claude hopes to build his own house.

loans.use: To purchase goods such as: lotions, sugar, soap, toothpaste, etc. to sell.

loans.name: C4914 Abahuje Group

texts.en:
Euphrem is 28 years old and is single. He sells shoes in his business which is open from 7am until 6pm every day. He currently employs one person to help him. He has had three years of experience in this business. Euphrem is the leader of the group which is called "C4914 Abahuje" in the local language.

Euphrem has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more shoes to sell. With this profit, Euphrem will save money for his future and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase shoes to sell.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
This is Manuel, 32, a resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. He is married to Hazel who is a housewife and mother to their two children. Together they manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for his everyday expenses.

Manuel operates a tricycle transportation business. He owns one unit of tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar attached into it) that carries up to four or five passengers to their destination within the community. He earns through the boundary (daily quota) that their driver remits each day. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 300 every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan for additional spare parts and the maintenance of his tricycle unit. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.  

Manuel hopes to be able to expand soon and to sustain their daily needs. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their Tricycle unit

loans.name: Juvenal

texts.en:
Juvenal is 40 years old and is married with two children aged 4 and 15 years old. Juvenal has four years' experience selling various goods like soap, cooking oil, sugar, etc. The hours of his business are from 6am to 8.30pm per day each week and he currently employs one person to help him.

Juvenal has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase various goods such as: soap, cooking oil, sugar, etc. to sell. With any profits from the loan, Juvenal would like to satisfy his family's basic needs and to start saving for his future.

loans.use: To purchase goods such as: soap, cooking oil, sugar, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Arshaan's Group

texts.en:
Arshaan is married and 56 years of age. She is illiterate and spends her time staying at home and carrying out her household responsibilities. She lives with her two brothers and three children. Her elder brother is a rickshaw driver and provides transport services to passengers and school children. He is a very experienced driver and drives his auto rickshaw very safely. Her eldest son is also a rickshaw driver while the others are studying. 

Arshaan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her son who wants to repair his rickshaw. By doing this, he will be able to provide better transport services to his passengers and will increase his income. Arshaan is very confident that her son will be able to achieve good success in his business after the loan investment. 

Note: In the photo, the lady holding the book (called an Asasah Passbook) is Arshaan.

loans.use: To repair a rickshaw

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy provisions and some condiments for making food

loans.name: Jean Nepomuscene

texts.en:
Nepomuscene is 28 years old and is married. He takes care of two dependents. Nepomuscene sells local drinks. This is his second year in this business. He works from 6am until 5pm every day and currently employs one person to help him. 

Nepomuscene has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase large quantities of sorghum to make local drinks to sell. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase large quantities of sorghum to make local drinks to sell.

loans.name: Affodote Group

texts.fr: Le groupement AFFODOTE est formé de dix huit personnes qui habitent la même agglomération et mènent pratiquement les mêmes activités. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Aimée est celle qui est assise devant et qui a la main levée sur la photo. Aimée est âgée de 32 ans et est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Pascal. Le couple a cinq enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Le couple subvient ensemble aux différents besoins du ménage. Aimée n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Depuis près de six ans, Aimée produit et vend de la farine de manioc dans sa région. Parallèlement à cette activité, Aimée vend divers condiments dans sa région ; ce qui permet d’assurer ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la famille. Aimée achète ses produits dans un village du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Aimée et les autres membres du groupement AFFODOTE sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur permettra de renforcer leur activité et d'accroître leur chiffre d’affaire, afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
The group AFFODOTE is comprised of eight persons who live in the same town and who work practically in the same businesses. The group's representative, Aimée, is the one in the photo seated in front with her hand raised. Aimée is 32 years old and married to a farmer named Pascal. They have five children, some of whom are in school. The children are all in their care. The couple jointly meet the different household needs. 

Aimée did not attend school. For nearly six years, she has been making cassava flour and selling it in her region. Concurrent to this business, she sells a variety of condiments in her region. This enables her, along with her husband, to ensure that the diverse family expenses are covered. She purchases her supplies in a village in Benin. 

This is the first time Aimée and the other members of the group AFFODOTE have requested a loan from ALIDé. This loan will enable them to bolster their businesses (and increase their sales) to respond better to the demands of their customers.

loans.use: to buy sacks of cassava to process into cassava flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Remedio

texts.en:
Remedio, aged 50, is a resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. He is married to Jesselyn, a caregiver and mother to their three children. The eldest child is already in high school while the other two are still at home. Remedio, together with his wife, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Remedio operates a rolling store. His rolling store is basically a small household products store, which retails plastic containers, dippers, pails, plastic flowers and basins to the local neighborhood. He drives the rolling store within the local community to sell the products. He earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 800 in sales every day.

To help him continue operating his business, he is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy pails, plastic-ware, hangers, clothes pins, plastic flowers and other items to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Remedio hopes that his business will continue to be successful and dreams of having a permanent store. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and can also draw strength and inspiration there from the Word of God that he studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy stocks of plastic-ware products and other items needed in his business

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is married to Leah and they have two children who are six and four years old. He runs a retail shop in his area and this business has been in operation for the last half a year. He is able to generate a profit of 6,000 shillings every month. His wife is a housewife and thus does not contribute to the family’s total income.

Moses is a good client with KADET LTD and has requested his second loan after repaying the first loan well and with no delays. He will use the loan amount to add more stock of items like sugar, flour and cooking fat which are currently running low. He hopes to use the anticipated profits to add more stock to his business. 

He hopes to open a bigger store for running his business and to be able to educate his children to the highest level possible.

loans.use: to buy stock of items like sugar, flour and cooking fat which are running low.

loans.name: Shamal

texts.en:
Shamal is a 20-year-old young, energetic Iraqi man. Since the age of 16, he has been working hard to help support his family and himself with a barber shop. He has been in business for four years. 

Being so young himself, he has a great understanding of his young clientele and he has taken a modern approach to the traditional role of an Iraqi barber shop. With a keen eye for detail and style, he is eager to give his young clients a great experience in his shop.

Since the opening of the shop, the area of the city where it is located developed quickly, and is now one of the most popular shopping and entertainment areas in the city. 

As the picture also shows, he has done a really good job of creating an attractive and clean barber shop, using all kinds of posters. Shamal took a loan from Relief International-Iraq in the amount of 1,200 USD to refurbish the salon in order to better keep up with the trends in the area, and be able to attract the new clients walking by his store, allowing him to grow and continue to give the help to his family they need.

loans.use: to pay for improvements to his barbershop

loans.name: Gulshan's Group

texts.en:
Gulshan has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the expansion of her sewing center business. She is very skilful in her work and has trained many females in her community. She also receives orders from different clients and completes those orders to supplement the income for her family. With the loan investment, she will buy another sewing machine and hire a worker for her assistance. This will help her expand her business and increase her profits.
 
Her husband is a fruit seller and offers his clients fresh seasonal fruits. Gulshan has given birth to two sons and two daughters. Her daughters are embroidery experts and her sons stay at home. 

She is confident that she will get further success in her business after an investment.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and hire a worker

loans.name: Im

texts.en: Im, 37, is single and resides with her mother and a sister in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She and her sister are garment workers. She has been working in the garment factory since 2005 and earns less income. Therefore, she would like to request a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a plot of farming land to grow agricultural crops to generate extra income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her farming business and renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of farmland

loans.name: Samoeurn

texts.en: Samoeurn, 53, is married and resides with her husband and eight children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her husband is a construction worker. Six of her children are employed. Two of them are soldiers, one is a garment worker, two more are construction workers and the last one is employed in Malaysia as a homemaker. Since her daughter has trouble with her transportation to work, Samoeurn is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase a motorbike for her daughter to use to commute to work. By doing so, she can save some money from her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her husband's business to be a construction foreman. Moreover, she plans to renovate her house and support her son to study until he gets his Bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her daughter

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia doesn’t have any children. She spends her time sewing for her neighboring clients. She is very skilful and has learned the art of sewing from her mother. 

Her husband operates 2 businesses. He owns a grocery store and also a tailoring business. He gives the required time to his businesses so he gets no complaints from his customers but can easily satisfy them through his services. Asia has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband. With the loan investment, he will buy groceries for his grocery store, buy a new sewing machine and hire a worker who will assist him in completing the orders on time. 

He is very experienced in his businesses and Asia is hopeful that an investment will be more productive for him.

loans.use: to buy groceries and a new sewing machine for grocery store and tailoring businesses

loans.name: Chanthoeurn

texts.en: Chanthoeurn, 26, is married and resides with her husband and child in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She and her husband are garment workers. Chanthoeurn is requesting a loan of USD $1,000 to purchase construction materials to build her house. In the future, she would like to run a poultry farm and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build her house

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 47-year-old Iraqi man with a family of four children. For 16 years, he has been working hard to support his family, setting a great example for both his family and other small businesses. 

Despite working hard, in the past he was only able to generate a small income with a small coffee shop in the market area of the city. Then he had the opportunity to receive a small loan from Relief International-Iraq, which allowed him to sell food also. With his newly found passion for food, and an opportunity to grow, after repayment of his loan he took a second loan, which allowed him to open a small restaurant. 

The restaurant has been steadily growing. Ali now took a loan from RI-Iraq for 3,000 USD to provide a better variety of choices and be able to have fish from the nearby lake on his menu as well. He will also improve the electricity and lighting in the restaurant.
