Ali is glad he had the opportunity to grow and is happy about being able to support not only his family from the business, but also help a few other families through employment in his restaurant.

loans.use: to pay for lighting in his restaurant and buy equipment to introduce fish on the menu

loans.name: C 6830 Twisungane Group

texts.en:
Donathile is 32 years old. She sells secondhand clothes in her business, which is open from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m. everyday except on Sundays. She currently employs four people to help her. She is the leader of the group called "C 6830 TWISUNGANE" in the local language. Donathile has three years of experience.

Donathile has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more secondhand clothing to sell. With any profit, she will save money for her future and she will be able to renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase more secondhand clothing to sell

loans.name: Kimly

texts.en:
Kimly, 26, is married and resides with her husband and a child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

She is a garment worker. Her husband refills gas into small cans that he sells to his clients for use with gas stoves. Additionally, he rents sound equipment for the villagers in his village. 

Kimly is requesting a loan of USD 600 to expand her husband's business by purchasing more gas to refill the cans in order to sell. 

In the future, she plans to add delivery service in her husband's business and build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more gas to sell.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her sewing and embroidery business. She started her business few years ago to financially support her husband, who is a clerk in an organization and was not able to fulfill the basic needs of the family.
 
Now she is well established in her business and has gained a lot of experience and skills. 

With the loan investment, she will buy a new sewing machine because her current machine has become old and she is unable to use it effectively. By purchasing a new sewing machine, she will be able to complete the orders on time and increase her income. 

Naseem has given birth to three children. All of them are enrolled in local school and getting their education.  

She is confident that by improving her business, she will be able to earn more income and her children will be able to continue getting their education. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Naseem.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for the sewing business.

loans.name: Poch

texts.en:
Poch, 51, is married and resides with her husband and one child in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area that is well known for its historical tourism sites (ancient temples such as Angkor Wat, Bayon and Banteay Srey). 

She and her husband produce Khmer traditional musical instruments to sell. The instrument is called a tro and is similar to the violin. It has two strings and is played with a bow. 

Poch is requesting a loan to purchase more wood to produce more tros to sell. In the future, she would like to grow her business by hiring more people to help her produce more tros to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more wood to produce more tros to sell.

loans.name: C4728 Abishyizehamwe Group

texts.en:
Pelagie is 28 years old, married, and has three children between the ages of 4 and 9 years. She sells second-hand clothing in her business, which is open from 8 am until 7 pm every day except Sundays. She is the leader of the group called "C4728 Abishyizehamwe" in the local language. Pelagie has ten years of experience.

Pelagie has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more second-hand clothing to sell. With any profit, she will save money for her future and she will be able to renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase more second-hand clothing to sell.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is 46 years old, married with three children aged 18, 20 and 24.  She runs a greengrocery to earn a living.  She has been in this business for three years and has employed one person. In her business, she mainly sells vegetables; potatoes, tomatoes and onions. She says her business environment is competitive.

Since Christina joined Faulu Kenya, she has learnt how to save her money. This has helped her to manage her finances. Her desire is to be selling vegetables in five years' time. She has applied for a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy tomatoes, potatoes and onions.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, potatoes and onions

loans.name: Adil

texts.en:
Adil is a 28-year-old, ambitious married Iraqi man with a shop that manufactures and supplies high quality PVC casement windows and doors.

The business has been steadily growing in the past seven years, and with numerous construction sites around the city, it is expected to keep growing and successfully generating revenue.

Adil took a loan from Relief International-Iraq for 3,000 USD to purchase a special machine for the factory used for melting/holding the frame elements together.

loans.use: to purchase a special machine for the window and door factory

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen, 44, is married and lives with her family, a husband and four children. Besides her elder daughter, the others are free. 

Her elder daughter is involved in the sewing business. She sews clothes for her relatives and neighboring customers and financially contributes to the family.  She is a very sincere and passionate girl. She loves doing her work because she has lots of interest. She sews dresses with perfect measurements and impresses her customers with her skills. 

Parveen’s husband is involved in a sanitary supplies selling business. He also offers his services of installing the sanitary supplies for the customers as they require. He has been in this business for many years. 

Parveen herself is a caring woman. She does her household responsibilities by staying at home. 
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. He will invest the loan in the purchase of sanitary supplies like water pipes and taps in larger quantities for reselling. 

She is hopeful that her husband’s business will grow further after making an investment into it. 

Note: One of the group members has a sewing business. That’s why she has shown her sewing business.

loans.use: to buy sanitary supplies for reselling.

loans.name: C14001 Twitezimbere Group

texts.en:
Dativa is 29 years old and has three children between the ages of 3 and 8 years. She also takes care of three additional dependents. She sells local drinks from 7 am until 6 pm every day, and she has four years of experience. She currently employs three people to help her. She is the leader of the group called "14001 TWITEZIMBERE" in the local language. She is a first person from the left in the photo.

Dativa has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase a large quantity of sorghum to make local drinks to sell. With any profit, she will save money for her future and pay school fees for all of the children who live with her.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of sorghum to make local drinks to sell.

loans.name: Lim

texts.en:
Lim, 55, is married, and resides with her husband and three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area which is well known for its historical tourism sites (the ancient temples Angkor Wat, Bayon, Banteay Srey, etc.). 

She produces trunks which are made of palm leaves to sell. Her husband is a carpenter. All of her children are employed; one is a room maker, another a chef, and the third a dancer. Due to the difficulty in traveling to work, Lim requests a loan to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work. In the future, she plans to raise pigs at home and build new house.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work

loans.name: Sitharanaet

texts.en:
Sitharanaet, 48, is married and resides with her husband and two school-age children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area which is well known for its historical tourism sites such as the ancient temples Angkor Wat, Bayon, and Banteay Srey. 

She grills chicken and beef to sell at the market. Her husband is a security guard. Sitharanaet requests a loan of $400 to purchase more chickens to resell at the market. By doing so, she can generate more income to support her family. In the future, she would like to rent a big store to sell her grilled chickens and beef in the market, renew her house and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens to resell at the market

loans.name: Kasangaki

texts.en: Kasangaki is 34 years old, married and the father of two children. They live in Hoima, Uganda. He has no other dependents and his family goal is to educate his children up to university level. He is a farmer and has also traded in produce for the past three years. He faces the challenge of new taxes being levied on his goods. His business goal is to own a food store. Kasangaki needs a loan to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Soeurn

texts.en:
Soeurn, 26, is married, resides with his wife and child in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area which is well known for its historical tourism sites such as the ancient temples Angkor Wat, Bayon, and Banteay Srey. He and his wife are construction workers.

Soeurn is requesting a loan of $1,200 US to purchase a plot of land to build a new house to live in. In the future, he would like to raise pigs at home and send his child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land to build a new house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy radios to sell.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 45-year-old married woman with five children living with her husband, who works as a bus driver for one of the private universities.

Hanan started her project in her house, sewing and repairing clothes, and then moved on to buying clothes to sell directly to her friends, neighbors and clients.

Being an ambitious woman, she recently rented a store to sell clothes and for all ages. Not forgetting her original business, she still repairs and customizes clothes upon a client’s request.

She would like to get a loan to be able to buy new material to display in her store and expand her work to increase her profit and help her husband provide a better life for the family.

loans.use: to buy new material to display in her store and expand her work to increase her profit.

loans.name: Arpik

texts.en: Arpik lives in Shikahogh village with her husband, parents-in-law, and son. She works at the local preserve. Arpik's husband is a machinist. Arpik and her husband have been engaged in agriculture for fifteen years: they keep cattle and cultivate land. Arpik has requested a loan to expand her farm. With the loan's help she plans to purchase two cows and forage. Arpik will increase her income from the sales of milk and ensure a better future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase cows and forage.

loans.name: Ayesha Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Ayesha Bibi, aged 55 years, is an uneducated woman. She has given birth to three children: two sons and a daughter. Her elder son is a laborer while her youngest son studied until the 6th standard level. Her daughter is uneducated and helps Ayesha in managing the household work and taking care of the family members. 

Ayesha’s husband is a cobbler by profession. He makes shoes on order. His work is home based. He gets orders from different shoe factories and shoe shops and meets them on time to generate income for the family.
 
Ayesha has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will purchase leather, nails and a shoe polisher in larger quantities for finishing the orders and to earn maximum profits.  Ayesha is hopeful that her husband’s business will be expanded further after the loan investment.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (an Asasah Passbook) is Ayesha Bibi.

loans.use: to buy leather, nails and a shoe polisher for shoemaking business

loans.name: Ghassan

texts.en:
Ghassan, 39, is the father of two sons and four daughters. He has an advertising company with low income, and is also raising sheep and selling their products to increase his income and provide his family with better living conditions. 

Ghassan wants to purchase fodder to feed the sheep he is raising. He needs to get a loan from FATEN, since the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay for fodder. 

When Ghassan gets the loan, he will be able to secure the amount of fodder that is necessary to feed the sheep. That will increase the productivity of his sheep, so his sales will increase and his income will increase, too. That will help Ghassan to create better living conditions for his family. 

Ghassan is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase fodder for the sheep he is raising.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 41-year-old married woman, the mother of one child. She started a new business in January 2011, to help her husband with their living costs. Fatima is a hard worker: she works to improve her business as much as she can, in order to meet all customers' needs and requests. She has introduced her customers to many different products such as accessories, perfumes and cosmetics, in addition to an international calls service.

Fatima is a hard-working woman, she puts much effort into improving her business and helping her husband. To do so, Fatima has asked for Kiva partner Al Majmoua's help, through applying for a loan. This loan will definitely help her to improve her business which will reflect positively on her social living. Fatima hopes to expand her business more and more in the future.

loans.use: To start selling prepaid mobile cards and to support her perfumes and accessories trade

loans.name: Samira

texts.en:
Samira is a housewife and a mother of 10 children. She and her husband live in a refugee camp and she helps her husband, who is a blacksmith, in running a small workshop they own.

Since they are living a hard life trying to provide for their large family, Samira has applied in hope to get a loan to be able to help her husband expand his workshop and also help with the household expenses since he is the only provider for the family.

Because Samira is a conservative person, her son Samer has agreed to appear in the photo instead.

loans.use: to help her husband expand his workshop and also help with the household expenses since he is the only provider for the family.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en: Pauline is a 37-year-old hard-working man with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. His personal goal is to educate his children. He has been running a retail shop for a period of four years. His major hardship is price fluctuations. However, he has the goal of expanding his business into new areas. Pauline needs a loan to buy soap and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy timber for furniture making.

loans.name: Monyonmu

texts.en: Monyonmu is 21 years old and lives in Congo Town. She is married with two children aged 3 and 9 years old; the oldest one attends school and both of them live at home. Monyonmu has been selling slippers for the past three years. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and she has learnt this business from him. Her favorite part about her business is that it gives her more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more goods (slippers) for her business; in future she wants to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more goods (slippers) for her business

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad, who is a 37-year-old man, is the father of two sons and two daughters. He is a bulldozer driver with a decent salary, but he is looking at the future of having his own bulldozer. Mohammad wants to improve the quality of his work by purchasing a huge digging piece for the bulldozer he drives, but he doesn't have enough money to pay, so he needs to take a loan from FATEN. Getting this loan will help Mohammad to improve his working conditions and allow him to complete the work required in less time and with higher quality. That will allow Mohammad to work more and increase his income to offer his family better living conditions. Mohammad is photographed in this picture.

loans.use: to purchase a digging piece for the bulldozer he drives

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is a very active lady. She supports her husband financially by preparing wooden stools. She started this business a few years ago. She is a very hard worker by nature. While working, she never thinks of day and night. Her work is very demanding in her area. Her husband is a mason by profession and constructs houses and buildings by contract. He is known as an expert in his work and offers quality services to his clients. Naseem is the mother of 2 sons.  

She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her eldest son, who makes and sells shawls at different clothing shops in the market. He sells a variety of shawls, such as embroidered, simple and colorful shawls, to his customers. With the loan investment, he will buy colored thread, beads and laces in bulk quantities that will allow him to make better quality and a higher variety of shawls, selling them at higher profits. 

Naseem is confident that an investment will help her son make his business better. 

Note: “In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Naseem.”

loans.use: to buy colored thread, beads and laces for a shawls-making business

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 33 years old, single with one child aged 10. She runs a business selling second-hand clothes to earn a living. She has been in this business for four years and has employed one person.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Esther has improved her business with her first loan. This helped her to increase her level of income. Her desire is to buy a plot and build her home in the future. She has applied for a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy second-hand shoes to resell.

loans.use: to buy second-hand shoes to resell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is a thirty-four-year-old hardworking lady with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. Her personal goal is to build a permanent house. She has been running a clothes-selling business for the last ten years after starting with capital of eighty thousand, and now the business has grown to over two million as working capital. Her major challenges are price fluctuations, inflation and customers not paying on time; however, she has a goal of expanding her business to new areas. Evelyn needs the credit facility to buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Thafer

texts.en:
Thafer, who is a 23-year-old young man, is a father to one son. He is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. He also has an entertainment store for playing pool and table games located in a good area.  

Thafer wants to expand his store by purchasing extra numbers of pool tables. He also wants to have a fridge for soft drinks so his costumers can enjoy drinking soft drinks while they are playing. 

He needs to take a loan from FATEN to pay for these items. When Thafer gets the loan, he will be able to increase the number of pool tables and offer soft drinks to his customers who are come daily to play. That will increase his income and improve his family's life conditions. Thafer is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase pool tables and a fridge for soft drinks.

loans.name: Bashiraan's Group

texts.en:
Bashiraan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her thread making business. With the loan investment, she will purchase old warm clothes like sweaters and then gets thread from it to sell at the local market for a profit. She is a very creative minded and skilful lady and earns reasonably good income from her business.
 
Her husband is a laborer by profession. His income is not confirmed every day because some days he doesn’t get any work. Bashiraan has given birth to a son who is young and works as a mason. She is also a very good housewife and performs her household duties very well along with her business. 
She is confident that she will successfully be able to make good use of the loan and improve her business.

loans.use: To buy old warm clothes for her thread selling business

loans.name: Dulce Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité Dulce Esperanza  se formó con la unión de 16 vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso.  Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes ,  pero también actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo.
La Señora Demetria es una de las integrantes del comité, ella se dedica  a la costura y decoración de eventos, es una señora muy trabajadora, creativa, activa  y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.  Ella tiene  5 hijos y su marido es electricista. Se encuentra muy satisfecha con sus actividades y las capacitaciones que recibe el grupo.  Ella comenta que junto a su marido están tratando de salir adelante y ayudar a su familia.
La señora Demetria solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, cierres, botones y demás insumos para abastecer su taller.
texts.en:
The committee "Dulce Esperanza" [Sweet Hope] was formed with the uniting of 16 neighbors from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso. All the committee's members carry out independent business activities, but they also have activities that strengthen their camaraderie. 

Ms. Demetria is one of the committee's members. She devotes herself to sewing and decorating for events. She is a very hardworking woman, creative, active and with a great desire to get ahead. She has five children and her husband is an electrician. She is quite happy with her businesses and with the trainings the group receives. She comments that, along with her husband, she is trying to get ahead and help their family. 

Ms. Demetria requests the loan for the purchase of cloth, zippers, buttons, and other supplies for stocking her workshop.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, zippers, buttons and other supplies.

loans.name: Munah

texts.en: Munah is 36 years old and lives in Congo Town. She is married with five children, aged between 1 and 17 years old. Three attend school and all live at home. Munah has been selling fashion slippers for the past twenty years. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and she learned this business from her oldest sister.  What she likes about her business is that it gives her more profit and makes her more popular. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fashion slippers for her business. In future she wants to attend medical school.

loans.use: to purchase more fashion slippers for her business.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a 28-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She started in 2010 working from her house. She started selling perfumes and cosmetics. Caroline is a hardworking woman, and she insists on helping her husband earn their living.

To do so, Caroline worked hard to expand her selling and to increase her customers to the extent that she is now requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to open a shop to start her wider business in it. Most of her customers are relatives, friends and neighbors. The shop will help in attracting new customers and increasing her income.

She hopes to expand her business more and more in the future through starting wholesale trade.

loans.use: To open a perfume and cosmetics shop.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
12 mujeres  se juntaron  con el objetivo de interiorizarse sobre  los beneficios ofrecido por la Fundación Paraguaya a través de su programa Comité de Mujeres Rurales,  el cual les resultó una excelente oportunidad,  motivo por la cual decidieron conformar el comité.  El comité lleva por nombre Kuña Guapa, debido a que se consideran personas muy trabajadoras, quienes se comprometen a mantener unido el grupo, actualmente se encuentran en el  tercer ciclo.
Una de esas mujeres es la señora Josefina, quien nos comenta que se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de prendas, ella dice que su trabajo le gusta mucho ya que es digno y honesto. Gracias a esto ha podido salir adelante y ayudar a su familia. Ella desea poder seguir creciendo, para que de esa forma siga ayudando a su familia.
Rlla solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de verano, con las cuales podrá abastecerse y tener más variedad para poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Twelve women got together with the object of learning more about the benefits offered by Fundación Paraguaya through the Rural Women's Committee program. It seemed to them an excellent opportunity, and so they decided to form the committee. The committee has as its name Kuña Guapa given that they considere themselves to be very hardworking people who are committed to keeping the group close. Currently they are in their third loan cycle. 

One of the women is Ms. Josefina, who comments to us that she devotes herself to the sale of all kinds of clothing. She says she likes the work very much since it is dignified and honest. Thanks to this she has been able to get ahead and help her family. She wishes to continue growing in order to be able to continue helping her family. 

She requests the loan for the purchase of summer clothing with which to stock up and provide greater variety to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase summer clothing for later sale.

loans.name: Allah Walle Group

texts.fr:
Mme SAFOURA est la représentante du groupe ALLAH WALLE. Elle est  mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 14ans et le moins âge 03ans. 03 va  à l’école. Elle a 02 personnes  en charge.

Elle est gérante d’un kiosque depuis 01an. Elle s’approvisionne  dans une boutique et au  marché de pissy en ville. Ses clients sont  les jeunes du quartier.

Elle veut  s’acheter  02caisses de bière, 02caisses de sucrerie grosse bouteille et 01caisse de sucrerie petite bouteille.

 Mme utilise ses bénéfices pour renforcer son activité et assurer son bien être. Elle ambitionne s’acheter une moto, une parcelle et assurer l’éducation  de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mme SAFOURA is the representative of the group called ALLAH WALLE. She is married and the mother of four children. The oldest is 14 and the youngest three years old. She is responsible for two other people. 

She has been managing a kiosk for one year. She buys her merchandise in a store and at the Pissy Market in town. Her customers are the young people of the neighborhood. 

She wants to buy two cases of beer, two cases of big bottles of soda, and one case of small bottles of soda. 

Mme Safoura uses her profit to bolster her business and to insure her well-being. Her ambition is to buy a motorcycle and a plot of land, and to ensure the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy beer and sodas for resale.
